story:
Gravel here with our fourth Indiegogo campaign! We’re passionate about designing travel products that become trusty companions.

 

We’re building an ecosystem of travel products that work together. We’ve spent the past 2+ years researching & designing travel bags to enhance the way you travel.

Introducing the Gravel Bag System - Three bags that work as ONE to keep you moving forward.

Every day on the move is a bit different - you’ve got to be prepared for what’s next. Some days require bringing a lot of stuff like a rain jacket, camera, water...especially when you’re in a new place. Other days you need to travel light.

We found ourselves constantly digging through our bags to get stuff in & out. Travel demands quick access & comfort. Unless you’re the kind of person that packs one pair of underwear you should have a bag that’s designed to keep your stuff right by your side & adapt to you while on the move. We thought there had to be a better way.

Three products were born to work together:
42L Carry-On Backpack
Sling Belt (Hip Belt/Sling Bag)
11L Day Bag

See how they all work together. Here's a super high level overview of each bag.

42L Carry-On Backpack. 

Pack it all into a plethora of sensible pockets, access it quickly, & stay comfy with adjustable straps & structure. We'll get into all the juicy details in a moment. Of the Gravel Travel System - this is the home base.

Sling Belt. Yes, we made that up.

We’re super excited to share our patent pending backpack waist strap that quickly detaches from the 42L Carry-On Backpack & converts to a sling bag. 

A true 2-in-1. You know when you're trying to get to your seat & you have to stuff your pockets full of all your stuff? We thought it would make sense to just...take off the part of your bag already carrying all that stuff and take it with you!

Want to take essentials with you on a day trip exploring? Take it everywhere.


Ok! Now we've gotten to know each bag at a high level you probably want to learn more. 

Video Walkthroughs:

How to back this campaign:

1. Click "Back This Project"

2. Pick your reward level

3. Want to add more bags or accessories to your reward? Check out the graphics at the bottom of the campaign titled "à la carte" and increase your pledge amount accordingly. (Shipping for additional items will be collected post Indiegogo via BackerKit surveys )

Jump to our FAQ if you need a more detailed answer

All three bags work together. We've intentionally made each bag look simple & clean but there is a ton under the hood. Here’s a run-through of each bag.

42L Carry-On Backpack

Intentional spaces, sensible pockets, & adaptable to fit it all. 

Let's start with the inside. 

Stay organized w/soft fleece lined panels & dividers for modular storage. Secure down & compress stuff down w/adjustable cinch straps (sold as a set (2) in the à la carte menu).  

14 different loops lining the inside allow you to cinch your stuff the way you want.

Let's talk packing & accessing tech/miscellaneous items then start moving to the outside of the bag. 

Store stuff like a keyboard, charger, USB sticks on the inside panel that fully unzips for easy access & visibility.

Secure your laptop in a dedicated laptop pocket that fits up to the new 16" Macbook Pro. 

Water bottle pocket stays flat while zipped & unzips partially or fully to fit a 40 Ounce HydroFlask.

Pockets on all outside panels of the bag (top, bottom, front, sides). Quick access to stuff like your snacks & water, rain jacket, or a travel adapter. 

 Front Pocket stows away the 11L Day Bag.

Expandable front-pocket for quick access to bigger items like a toiletry bag or day bag.  Great for grabbing liquids for TSA scans.

Strap down taller or larger items on the outside like a tripod or a Gravel day bag w/loops on both sides & front w/g-hook straps.  

Think of the last time you thought “I’m sick of carrying this heavy freakin’ backpack.” We took inspiration from backpacking backpacks & added vertically adjustable shoulder straps for proper fit & weight distribution. 

Suspension straps to bring load forward to reduce back strain. 

We also added suspension straps to relieve your shoulders from some of the weight of the backpack. They bring the bag forward to bring the center of mass inward.

Hovering mesh decreases back sweat and doubles as a roller bag passthrough.

 

Sling Belt (Sling Bag/Waist Belt)

Everything always by your side. We wanted to reduce the constant digging for stuff like chargers, snacks, wires, passport, AirPods. Hip belts take weight off your back although we thought they should also carry lots of stuff too at your side. Guess what?

Our patent pending hip belt carries a ton & transforms to a cross body sling bag. 2L of space w/four pockets (1L & two pockets per side).

Here's how easy it is to transform the Hip Belt to a Sling Pack.

Unclip while boarding the plane in the aisle and clip to your body. Don’t stop traffic and quickly get to your seat.

Stay organized in your seat and stop worrying about losing something. Wraps & secures around seat tray as a caddy for all the airplane seat necessities.

Just got to your destination? You're already packed for the day - detach & head out.

The hip belt is a standalone sling bag to carry stuff on your trip’s daily excursions.

11L Day Bag

For day trips when you need a little more stuff we designed a 11 liter day bag. 

Great for working remotely in a local café then getting out on daily excursions.  Plenty of pockets & tons of space to fit stuff like souvenirs, snacks, water, a camera, or a light jacket. Laptop pocket fits up to a 16" computer.

  • On your back.

  • Tote.

  • On the front or back of the 42L backpack w/g-hooks

  • Briefcase

As mentioned above - the day bag also collapses & stows away in front pocket of the 42L Backpack. 

Accessories (Use À La Carte Menu To Add)

Laundry Bag (Not Included with 42L Bag - Add-On Option Only)

Keep dirty laundry separate w/included laundry bag. It’s internal pocket separates stuff like a damp swimsuit or dirty shoes from the rest of your laundry. Made to fit the inside sizing of the 42L Backpack.

G-Hook w/soft seatbelt webbing to hang anywhere.

Cinch Straps (Not Included with 42L Bag - Add-On Option Only)

Used to strap stuff down inside & outside the duffle - need we say more?

Technical Details & Materials:  

Main Fabric: 300D Polyester w/TPO Coating w/Outer PU Coating...it's waterproof & super abrasion resistant.
         Zippers: YKK
         Buckles: YKK

Weight:
                            42L Carry-On Duffle: 4 lb 13 oz (2.32 kg)
                            Sling Belt (Hip Belt/Sling Bag): 9.6 oz (0.27 kg)
                            11L Day Bag: 1 lb 4.6 oz (0.57 kg)

How will COVID-19 affect this campaign?

 

We are experienced manufacturing products - especially bags. This is our 4th Indiegogo campaign & we know how something like COVID-19 can bring unexpected delays. We've always delivered on time so to keep that record & backer happiness we decided to give ourselves a few extra months of production time...just in case.

We'll keep you up to date and be hones as we go along!

When will it all ship?

December 2020

Timeline:

Chris met Lance in 2017 with an idea to design a better toiletry bag for traveling.

Holy smokes - we’ve shipped 50,000+ products to 100+ countries around the world. Because of your incredible support we've been able to continue to design products that make traveling a little easier and better.

We have the raddest Indiegogo backers around - we’re so thankful for the bestowed backer trust. We're busy designing a lineup of travel products that solve problems we and other travelers experience.

Lifetime Warranty

We are so confident in our product's build that we have added a lifetime warranty - plain and simple. If the bag doesn't hold up for what it was designed for then let us know and we'll make it right.

Return Policy

We only used premium materials to ensure years of use. We will repair or replace any bags that somehow don't hold up to do what the bags was designed to be used for. We do not offer refunds or returns on blankets that were received as a Indiegogo reward.

We’re passionate about creating amazing products and Indiegogo is a way for us to launch our brand. As you've read, Indiegogo isn't a store and rewards are a thanks for supporting the project which is why we cannot offer refunds or returns. Your pledge means so much and we take it very seriously. We will do anything we can to make sure that this exchange leaves with good vibes for everyone involved.

Outside The USA? International Customs Calculator

We are so pumped that we have shipped product to 100+ countries. Backer rewards are merchandise and not gifts. We value your support SO much and want to make every interaction super positive all the way through this process. If you are backing our project outside the USA you will have to pay customs.

Shipping fees DO NOT count toward customs fees. One thing we've learned is that every country has different customs fees. Here is a shipping calculator for you to understand what you will be paying your government to import this product.

https://www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator/

Need further help? Reach out to us at hello@graveltravel.com :D

Gravel Team

story:
The imBAGine handles all clothing in a single pack. Clean clothes go in one side, dirty clothes in the other. The imBAGine is designed to simplify travelling and solve clothes organisation.

 

 

You need the imBAGine, an incredible travel pack which stores your clothes and necessities in separate compartments, making it easy to find what you need, and isolating your clean and dirty clothes without having to worry about the smell or wetness.

 

 

… and when you get back home, you can just empty the dirty compartment and dump everything into the washing machine. And that's it!

 

 

Are you tired of packing and unpacking? Sometimes it’s hard to find something in a pile of travel cubes, and you end up filling up your suitcase with travel cubes instead of souvenirs. On top of that, have to find a bag for your dirty clothes – another unpacking nightmare when you get home!

 

 

From your last travel experience,

Think about how many travel cubes you had to unpack (it’s even worse when you have kids!); think about your clothes got wrinkled when you picked the wrong size travel cube; think about how many cubes you had to rife through before you could take a shower;

imBAGine can ease your life by easing these frustrations!

 

 

 

 

We call it the "T-partition". You can separately store your daily necessities in T-partition, so that you can find your desired items anytime, anywhere.

 

There's a floating partition in each compartment to completely isolate one side of stuff from another. This way, you can first put your clean clothes into one side of imBAGine at the start of your trip, then move clothes to the dirty side once worn. Upon finishing your journey, all clean clothes will be switched to the dirty side while the size of the imBAGine remains unchanged. Isn't it cool?

 

Simply pull out all dirty clothes from the imBAGine to your washing machine. If you want to separately wash your smelly socks and dirty underwear, just go ahead, we’ve isolated them for you during your whole journey to avoid cross bacterial infection. 

 

Different from other storage bags in the market, the cylindrical shape can effectively keep your clothes in the same position during travel, avoiding wrinkled clothing even after being folded up for a long time.

 

Got sweaty after whole-day trip? No worries! Our compartment for dirty clothes can completely isolate your smelly wet shirts.​

Water repellent inner layer

The inner and outer layer of imBAGine are both water repellent, water will bead up on the surface and won't penetrate the other compartment. 

Water repellent outer layer

 

Got a thicker jumper for winter travel? imBAGine features a zipper that can be opened to extend capacity by 20%!

 

The imBAGine features a built-in band to tie itself up when not in use. It also doubles as a way to quickly spot the side of clean / dirty clothes.

 

Without any bulky buckles or clips, you can easily pack the imBAGine into a small roll after use. It's also machine-washable. 

 

 

After certain product testing, we decided to use 190T Nylon to make the whole bag so as to strive a balance between durability and overall product weight.

 

 

 

We are Hong Kong designers and avid travelers. Inspired by our own travel experiences, we designed the compact Handycosy travel pillow to offer travelers a handy and cosy travel experience, just as the brand name suggests. 

The brand has also designed a range of travel and lifestyle products to offer customers convenience and comfort in life and in travel.

 

Whenever I go travel, I will use a storage bag to pack my clothes and daily items tidily to avoid the luggage polluting my clothes and to spare more space for souvenirs. However, most travel storage bag in the market are in rectangular shape, which take up a lot of space by themselves. Also, even though some storage bags have small compartments for dirty clothes, I still don’t want those smelly socks being placed with used underwear for the whole trip!  To save some spaces for souvenirs, I may just bring 2 trousers for a 5-day trip. The problem is, where should I store my used trousers if I want to wear it for one more day? To solve these problems, I created this imBAGine, where I can completely isolate my clean and dirty items with just one bag and the same capacity. As compared to regular shape, the cylinder shape is much more effective for compact storage, while with the T-partition I can separate my smelly socks, used underwear and trousers to avoid bacterial exchange! The compartments in each side of the bag allows me to put my daily items and clothes into one bag, so that I don’t have to unpack the whole luggage whenever I change the hotel. Most importantly, with the different sharp colors, I can easily identify my imBAGine from my boyfriend’s one even if we are sharing the same luggage!

When we started to share the prototype with our friends and business partners for real user feedback, we were surprised as many users were not only using this bag for travel, but also using it for storing sweaty shirts after Yoga course, separating clean clothes and used towel after going to beach, a tool bag for storing accessories like scarfs and belts, or even training their kids to pack their own bag (as imBAGine has 6 compartments to separate stuffs like toys, eating utensils, towels and a little cardigan)! They made me feel like I had created a treasure bag LOL. So I name this product as “imBAGine”, wishing all of you can use your imagination to think about how to use this bag in your unique way:)

Cheers, Lydia

story:
Free BEDA Super Anti-Theft Backpack Sweepstake

beda adjective - New York speak for "better".  Definition: higher in quality.

BEDA - backpacks of better quality, function, and style

Choose from BEDA (2 side pockets) or BEDA S (1 hidden bottle holder + 2 stripes)

* Power bank not included

Weekend trip - no problem!  Everything fits.

Getting BEDA to You ASAP

At the completion of this campaign, we will email instructions to confirm shipping information and your Perk choice - to help us ship your order correctly and faster.  Plus you will be able to track your order's shipment directly online. 

Our small batch run was sold out in a week.  Right now we have a second small batch ready to be shipped, with a larger batch planned.

Who Are We?

as it is USA (asitisusa.com) is based in NY, USA.  We are focused on handcrafted fashion accessories with the best materials and craftsmanship.  Our lines of designer fashion bags can be found in premier boutiques in Asia, Europe, USA.  We already successfully funded and delivered 3 campaigns on Kickstarter but we wanted to reach a different audience for this project.

Basic - BEDA - BEDA S Slimline

We have sold hundreds of Basic (the first model) backpacks and gotten feedback from enthusiastic owners for features in new models.  With that, we put together 2 new designs with our OEM partner, and sold a small batch run.  Now we want to get them out with a mass production run and increased color selections.  Indiegogo is the perfect platform for us to launch the BEDA and BEDA S Slimline models.

New Features from Basic to BEDA: low profile side pockets, built-in hood, cool back, steel cable, chest strap, premium waterproof materials, and cut resistant dense foam padding.

Differences between BEDA and BEDA S: The BEDA has 2 low profile side pockets.  The BEDA S has 2 large reflective stripes on the sides, and 1 hidden bottle holder that pulls out when needed. 

14 Day Campaign?!  Yes, we are so confident in the 2 BEDA models that we already sold and shipped a small batch run.   We are here on Indiegogo to ramp up production for a bigger batch and will start the fulfillment process after Indiegogo verifies contributions (about 15 days later) and hopefully get our production order in before the Chinese New Year holiday. 

Risks & Challenges

We aim to make fulfilling your order as smoothly as possible.  At the completion of this campaign, we will email instructions to confirm shipping information and your Perk choice - to help us ship your order correctly and faster.  Plus you will be able to track your order's shipment directly online. 

The only issue we may encounter is the high volume of orders during the Chinese New Year holiday.  For orders in the USA, we will work with the USPS; and local postal services in other countries so realistic shipping is late February to early March.

Any questions, please contact info@asitisusa.com

story:
IMPORTANT!

In order to avoid problems like package missing, the courier can't connect you.

Keep in mind that fill in your correct contact information when you are placing order：Shipping Address, Phone Number, and Email Address is a must.

From inspiration to implementation, Zero Breeze innovates the revolutionary battery-powered compact handheld air conditioner. Zero Breeze is capable of cooling 18 ℉ down in a 50 square feet room which can make the temperature of your tent, RV, home, office, college dorm, and many more places perfect.

Shipping Stage

 

 

How to get it!

Become a backer of this project and Pick a Reward. You will be pre-ordering the Zero Breeze. You'll get a special backer discount!  Want to buy more than one? Check out Rewards. Still confused? Check out How to Back this Project.

The Zero Breeze is effective, lightweight and easy to use. We use a rotary compressor making Zero Breeze efficient and portable allowing you to stay cool anywhere, anytime.

Similar products on the market don’t have a real air conditioning function. A majority just add water or ice into their device to create the cooling effect. Most of all, none are portable because they all need to be plugged in using an adapter to be used.

Zero Breeze can be used indoors or outside, it is suitable for many occasions, Having a Zero Breeze around is the best way to stay cool and beat the heat.

  

 

 Cool Airflow, Instant Breeze , & Regular Fan Airflow.

Has the easy accessible charging ports on each side of the control panel.

If you are using the Zero Breeze in a closed space like a tent, you just need simply attach the hose and extend the other end outside.

To use the bluetooth speaker, simply lift the front panel and connect to your phone. You can adjust volume levels and skip songs straight from the Zero Breeze.

The Power Bank contains 64 cells of 18650s, the same cells that Tesla uses. It is a 5-Hour Battery, allowing you total portability without having to worry about outlets.

The warm LED light provides the perfect amount of illumination for camping and other outdoor activities.

Zero Breeze is perfect for occasions like RV traveling, BBQs and family members gather together outdoor in the hot summer days etc.

 

 

 

 How to Back

1. Choose a reward level.

Everybody can choose one (and only one) reward level to back this project. You cannot choose 2 reward levels. Just one. You will get all items in that reward—you cannot swap things that you don't want for things that you do want.

2. Relax, you're done for now.

All details like shipping information and color preference will be collected via survey after this campaign has ended.

 

 

 


 

  • Lithium Ion Polymer Battery
  • Max Charge Voltage: 12.6V DC
  • Capacity:12V 43Ah 477Wh
  • Normal Voltage:12V DC
  • Operating TEMP: 32-140ºF（0-60ºC）
  • Normal use for about 5 hours
  • Charging time: 5 hours
  • Weight 8.8 lbs
  • Size: 18.32"  L* 6.46" W * 3.82" H

During our two year development of Zero Breeze, we extensively tested and improved the concept of a rotary compressor to achieve the smallest possible form factor and maximum air cooling results. After several iterations, we built a fully functioning portable air conditioner that works. 

Cool Air

 

 

 

Noise Friendly

 
 
 

Bluetooth

​​

 

Our team has improved the mini rotary compressor to meet and realize the cooling requirements of an air conditioner over the last 2 years of research and design. By breaking traditional concepts of fan or electronic cooling and realizing portable and DC powered compressor cooling, we've created a fully functioning portable air conditioner.

High efficient cooling conversion ratio of frequency conversion (120W of power comes out 400W of refrigerating capacity) fully meets the outdoor requirements and makes outdoor activities more enjoyable. The device has a Bluetooth speaker for entertainment and a night light & mobile charging for practical functions.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Zero Breeze is small self-funded company with limited resources. We’ve poured our hearts over the last 2 years into creating a great product fit for the masses.

In order to get the costs to a price we believe creates value for our customers, we need to have a large initial production run. We have already invested substantially in the design process as well as getting ready to bring Zero Breeze to the market and need your help to make this happen.

Your support will allow us to place our first large order with our manufacturers so that we can reduce production costs and get Zero Breeze in the hands of people everywhere.

story:
Keep Us Cool 

We are a family of 3 who, earlier this year, launched our candy business under the brand new California Cottage Food Law.  We've had an overwhelming response and we are growing fast!  Already four of our candies (Chocolate Fudge, Almond Brittle, Toffee Bark & Salted Chocolate Covered Caramels) have received ribbons, including a 2nd place for our original chocolate fudge that started it all.

We've had great success at fairs and festivals in the past few months.  We've already paid to do a dozen more events this year and have been accepted into a local Farmer's Market.  Sadly, our Pop-Up tent has pooped out!   Wind and use has bent most of the upper support.   We need a new one to keep our gooey chocolate candies (and us) from melting in the endless California sun.  

http://www.thekandyjar.com/

What We Need 

We've got some big events coming up in the fall and winter season.   We've already paid for the spots, additional health permits for the locations, insurance and still will need lots of ingredients.  After all of that, there isn't much money left.  

We had a sad and dingy pop-up that was beat up by sun, wear and tear and even some rain.  But the real death of it came in the form of winds.  The frame bent in a few places, bolts bent and a support piece finally broke out.  Some of the rivets are bent beyond repair and one corner is barely hanging on.  It takes tools to put it up and keep it up now. It’s time to replace it with something that better represents our bright and fun personality.

Any funds collected will go directly to:

  • A sturdy 10x10 Red & White Striped Pop-up Tent  
  • Accessories: in the form of Weights  & Walls to combat the wind and sun


Any additional money over our goal will be applied to any of the following future goals: 

  • Event fees and permits - Varies
  • A new mixer - $400
  • Website redesign - $50+/hr
  • More Chocolate Molds - $400
  • New 4 burner stove – $1400
  • Dishwasher - $1000
  • Kitchen Remodel for storage and function - ????


What You Get

As a campaign contributor, you can receive perks such as a

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Recipe Cards
  • Handmade wooden toys
  • Award winning candy
  • Recognition as one of our contributors on our webpage
  • And more…

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still use the funds to help us do as much as we can.


The Impact

Everyone is so worried these days.  Worried about bills, worried about our future, worried about our figures.  Wouldn't it be great to be a kid again?  

We’d love to bring everyone back to those fun days when they could indulge in real candy!  No substitutions of ingredients you can’t pronounce because “butter and milk is bad for you.”   We use real sugar, real butter and get real flavors.  Old Fashioned candy and Old Fashioned values.  Candy just like grandma used to make.

We do have canned goods and would like to be resourceful in all of our processes. So many have 4, 8 and 16oz jars (ball/mason) just lying around. We would love to bring these back to life rather than getting new each time. The glass jars themselves are infinitely usable as we must cleanse and boil them prior to use each time. Donations of jars (clean and without chips or cracks) would also be appreciated.


Who are we?

http://www.thekandyjar.com/

It all starts with a little boy growing up eating a chocolate fudge recipe given to his mother by his kindergarten teacher.   He helped make the fudge for years until mom said "I'm tired…you make it!"   It sparked an interest in deserts (read created a chocoholic) and so he expanded on that recipe and learned to make more sweets for himself.  

As an adult, when times were thin, he decided candy was a great way to give family and friends Christmas gifts (maybe in an attempt to keep those family and friends from getting thin, themselves).  They were such a hit, the next year people complained about getting regular gifts again. And from there it flourished because like us, our friends wanted candy year-round.  He knew he had something!

Today the candy recipes have expanded to include so much more than just chocolate.  OK let's face it; it's still a lot of chocolate.  And now it’s his family of 3 that get to share in the candy making.

We look forward to sharing our candy with you and your friends and family!



How You Can Help?

Donate what you can - every bit counts! Let's show the power of crowd. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share this campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Google +, LinkedIn, via email, your personal blog, your professional blog and by word of mouth!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know you support this project and what we are trying to do!
  • Donations of jars (clean and without chips or cracks) would also be appreciated.


*Local Delivery = La Mirada, Anaheim or any city surrounding either.

http://www.thekandyjar.com/

story:
Sandy has a heart of gold. She is raising her 2 granddaughters by herself, and sacrifices her own desires to ensure her 2 charges have everything they need to succeed in their school years and beyond. When grand-daughter Kassie got the opportunity to go to Washington DC, Sandy immediately started planning on how she could raise the funds. 

We want to surprise Sandy and Kassie with a gift- enough funds for the trip (flight and lodging). This would allow Kassie to take a fun and educational trip to our nation's capitol. More importantly, it would take the stress off of Sandy.

Sandy won't accept money directly from us- she is very staunch about this. She is a proud lady, and we want to respect that. We want to show Sandy that a community can come together and help a lady that is so deserving.

story:
What's this trip all about?

From June 15th to June 21st, Matt and I will be driving all around the state of Oregon taking photos, with a heavy emphasis on astrophotography. Oregon is renowned for it's beauty, but a lot of people don't realize just how diverse the state actually is. Our plan is to drive around the state for a week capturing all sorts of stunning photographs of Oregon's rugged and varied landscapes. We'll be taking particular advantage of the fact that Eastern Oregon is one of the most remote and light-pollution free areas in the lower 48 by spending every night capturing breathtaking views of Oregon's wild landscapes with the stars and the Milky Way's galactic center as a backdrop.

What We Need & What You Get

Gas is expensive. Even more so when you're rolling around in a Jeep Wrangler (what, you thought we'd take a car to some of the most remote and rugged parts of Oregon? Please!). What we need is simply some money to offset our gas and travel costs. To that end, we're asking for $1500, and in exchange, we'll be giving you guys beautiful, high-quality canvas prints of our photos in return! You will not only have the satisfaction of helping us out immensely, you'll receive beautiful, gallery-style artwork at prices FAR below what you would normally expect to pay for such pieces.

Our $1500 goal is JUST enough to cover the cost of our travel expenses and pay for the actual prints (Remember, these things aren't cheap! The prints alone will take up a very sizable portion of that $1500 goal.). Hitting that goal alone will be a huge blessing, but of course artists like Matt and me can ALWAYS use some additional funding. Cameras, lenses, software, and accessories are NOT cheap, and neither is driving to the most remote parts of the country to find a dark sky or a scenic view. So, if you guys can help us blow right past that goal, it will help insure that we're able to continue bringing you beautiful photos in the future and give us a head start on our next big astrophotography excursion.

The Canvases

The canvases we'll be sending all of you as perks are 1.5" gallery wrapped and come with hanging-hardware pre-installed, so they'll be ready for you to throw up on your wall as soon as they arrive. Shipping is FREE within the lower 48 states. Outside of that, some additional shipping charges may be required.

We're offering quite a few different sizes and pricing options, as well as quite a few different customization options, so please read this section and our perk descriptions thoroughly before selecting one!

Pictured above: a 1.5" gallery-wrapped canvas.

The way that this fundraiser works is that you will pre-order your canvas, then after Matt and me return and start editing the photos we took and posting watermarked preview images of them online, you'll be able to choose ANY of them that you would like . When the time comes for you to pick an image, we'll walk you through the process of deciding on an image, picking an orientation, choosing a border style, and any other options that you may have decided on.

Sizes and Options:

The canvas sizes that we are offering are as follows:

8" x 10"
11" x 14"
16" x 20"
18" x 24"

In addition to single canvases, we're also offering two, three, and four-canvas splits. Multi-canvas splits are singular images that are split across multiple canvases (Of course, you're also welcome to simply request multiple images instead of a split if you so desire). They're a great and very unique way to showcase a large panorama. Below is an example of a three-canvas split.


A three-canvas split creating a single 20" x 48" image.
When it comes to four canvas splits, you actually have two basic styles that you can choose from, as showcased by the example images below:

A two-row four-canvas split and a one-row four-canvas split.

Photo Orientation and Borders:

No matter which size or how many canvases you pick, you will be able to choose whether you want your pictures to be in landscape or portrait orientation, as well as the style of border you want on the canvas. If you don't already understand the difference between the landscape and portrait orientations, below is a nifty little photo demonstrating the difference. As you can see, which orientation you should choose depends on the content of a photo.

On the left, "landscape." On the right, "portrait."
The canvas border option you choose determines what the 1.5-inch-thick border of your image will look like. You can choose between simply having the image wrap around the edges, a mirrored version of the image wrap around the edges, the colors at the edges of the image extending around the edge and blurring, or a solid color edge. The simple image wrap is probably the most traditional, but personally I tend to prefer using a black solid-colored edge for astrophotography. The choice, however, is all yours!

Some examples of the many border styles you can choose!

Custom Text:

If you'd like to add an inspiration quote, a Bible verse, a song lyric, or a short poem to one of our canvases, you can do that! The cost to add text to a print is $25/canvas, and we will work with you to make sure that the font, size, color, shading, and positioning of the text are all to your liking.

As you can see, this perk is separate from all the other perks, and does NOT come with a canvas on it's own. To use it, you must purchase both it AND at least one canvas. If that seems confusing, let me explain:

  • If you want to get a single 16" x 20" canvas with your favorite Bible verse on it, you would purchase both the $80 "16x20 Canvas Print" perk AND the $25 "Custom Text" perk for a total cost of $105.
  • If you want to add a famous quote to one panel of a three-canvas-split, you would purchase both a three-canvas-split perk and ONE "Custom Text" perk.
  • If you want to add song lyrics to all four panels of a four-canvas-split, you will need to purchase both a four-canvas-split perk and FOUR custom text perks.
Make sense? If you have any questions or want to ask about a size or product that we aren't offering, feel free to contact us and we'll get back to you as soon as possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

We really, really appreciate any support that we can get! We know that money can be tight, though, so remember that even if you can't afford to buy a canvas right now, you can still help us out! Sharing our campaign and telling any of your friends and family members who you think might be interested about it is a GREAT way to help us out that costs you nothing but a few minutes of your time!

If you decide that you want to buy a canvas later after the fundraiser ends, don't worry! You'll still be able to do that... But you're not going to get nearly as good of a deal if you wait, so choose wisely!

Oh, and don't forget to follow Matt and me on Facebook and Instagram!

Matt Zietzke:
http://facebook.com/ZietzkePhotography
http://instagram.com/ZietzkePhotography

David West:
http://facebook.com/BuckTheSystem
http://facebook.com/DavidKirkWest
http://instagram.com/davidkwest
story_txt:
What's this trip all about?
From June 15th to June 21st, Matt and I will be driving all around the state of Oregon taking photos, with a heavy emphasis on astrophotography. Oregon is renowned for it's beauty, but a lot of people don't realize just how diverse the state actually is. Our plan is to drive around the state for a week capturing all sorts of stunning photographs of Oregon's rugged and varied landscapes. We'll be taking particular advantage of the fact that Eastern Oregon is one of the most remote and light-pollution free areas in the lower 48 by spending every night capturing breathtaking views of Oregon's wild landscapes with the stars and the Milky Way's galactic center as a backdrop.

What We Need & What You Get

 Gas is expensive. Even more so when you're rolling around in a Jeep Wrangler (what, you thought we'd take a car to some of the most remote and rugged parts of Oregon? Please!). What we need is simply some money to offset our gas and travel costs. To that end, we're asking for $1500, and in exchange, we'll be giving you guys beautiful, high-quality canvas prints of our photos in return! You will not only have the satisfaction of helping us out immensely, you'll receive beautiful, gallery-style artwork at prices FAR below what you would normally expect to pay for such pieces.
Our $1500 goal is JUST enough to cover the cost of our travel expenses and pay for the actual prints (Remember, these things aren't cheap! The prints alone will take up a very sizable portion of that $1500 goal.). Hitting that goal alone will be a huge blessing, but of course artists like Matt and me can ALWAYS use some additional funding. Cameras, lenses, software, and accessories are NOT cheap, and neither is driving to the most remote parts of the country to find a dark sky or a scenic view. So, if you guys can help us blow right past that goal, it will help insure that we're able to continue bringing you beautiful photos in the future and give us a head start on our next big astrophotography excursion.
The Canvases
The canvases we'll be sending all of you as perks are 1.5" gallery wrapped and come with hanging-hardware pre-installed, so they'll be ready for you to throw up on your wall as soon as they arrive. Shipping is FREE within the lower 48 states. Outside of that, some additional shipping charges may be required.
We're offering quite a few different sizes and pricing options, as well as quite a few different customization options, so please read this section and our perk descriptions thoroughly before selecting one!


Pictured above: a 1.5" gallery-wrapped canvas.   The way that this fundraiser works is that you will pre-order your canvas, then after Matt and me return and start editing the photos we took and posting watermarked preview images of them online, you'll be able to choose ANY of them that you would like . When the time comes for you to pick an image, we'll walk you through the process of deciding on an image, picking an orientation, choosing a border style, and any other options that you may have decided on.
Sizes and Options:
The canvas sizes that we are offering are as follows:
8" x 10"11" x 14"16" x 20"18" x 24"
In addition to single canvases, we're also offering two, three, and four-canvas splits. Multi-canvas splits are singular images that are split across multiple canvases (Of course, you're also welcome to simply request multiple images instead of a split if you so desire). They're a great and very unique way to showcase a large panorama. Below is an example of a three-canvas split.




A three-canvas split creating a single 20" x 48" image.When it comes to four canvas splits, you actually have two basic styles that you can choose from, as showcased by the example images below:

A two-row four-canvas split and a one-row four-canvas split.
Photo Orientation and Borders:
No matter which size or how many canvases you pick, you will be able to choose whether you want your pictures to be in landscape or portrait orientation, as well as the style of border you want on the canvas. If you don't already understand the difference between the landscape and portrait orientations, below is a nifty little photo demonstrating the difference. As you can see, which orientation you should choose depends on the content of a photo.


On the left, "landscape." On the right, "portrait."The canvas border option you choose determines what the 1.5-inch-thick border of your image will look like. You can choose between simply having the image wrap around the edges, a mirrored version of the image wrap around the edges, the colors at the edges of the image extending around the edge and blurring, or a solid color edge. The simple image wrap is probably the most traditional, but personally I tend to prefer using a black solid-colored edge for astrophotography. The choice, however, is all yours!

Some examples of the many border styles you can choose!
Custom Text:
If you'd like to add an inspiration quote, a Bible verse, a song lyric, or a short poem to one of our canvases, you can do that! The cost to add text to a print is $25/canvas, and we will work with you to make sure that the font, size, color, shading, and positioning of the text are all to your liking.
As you can see, this perk is separate from all the other perks, and does NOT come with a canvas on it's own. To use it, you must purchase both it AND at least one canvas. If that seems confusing, let me explain:


If you want to get a single 16" x 20" canvas with your favorite Bible verse on it, you would purchase both the $80 "16x20 Canvas Print" perk AND the $25 "Custom Text" perk for a total cost of $105.
If you want to add a famous quote to one panel of a three-canvas-split, you would purchase both a three-canvas-split perk and ONE "Custom Text" perk.
If you want to add song lyrics to all four panels of a four-canvas-split, you will need to purchase both a four-canvas-split perk and FOUR custom text perks.

Make sense? If you have any questions or want to ask about a size or product that we aren't offering, feel free to contact us and we'll get back to you as soon as possible!

    Other Ways You Can Help We really, really appreciate any support that we can get! We know that money can be tight, though, so remember that even if you can't afford to buy a canvas right now, you can still help us out! Sharing our campaign and telling any of your friends and family members who you think might be interested about it is a GREAT way to help us out that costs you nothing but a few minutes of your time!
If you decide that you want to buy a canvas later after the fundraiser ends, don't worry! You'll still be able to do that... But you're not going to get nearly as good of a deal if you wait, so choose wisely!Oh, and don't forget to follow Matt and me on Facebook and Instagram!Matt Zietzke:http://facebook.com/ZietzkePhotographyhttp://instagram.com/ZietzkePhotography
David West:http://facebook.com/BuckTheSystemhttp://facebook.com/DavidKirkWesthttp://instagram.com/davidkwest

story:
Introducing Jurni: The Ultimate Suitcase for Young Travelers

Jurni is a carry-on suitcase for the next generation of young connected travellers. With a quick access pop-out pod, a seat to rest on, in-line wheels to glide-along and flexible storage solutions, Jurni makes teenage travel a breeze.

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW


“This May Be The Best Carry-On Suitcase Idea We've EVER Seen”  

Huffington post

“Jurni ride-on suitcase lets you glide through your travels” Gizmodo 

“Trunki on a roll with new suitcase for grown-ups” Telegraph

Insights

  • Airports are getting more crowded resulting in long queues and lack of seating
  • The majority of people travel with mobile tech & need quick instant access to it
  • Hand Luggage lack’s functionality and usability once at your destination

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW


Features


It’s more than just a carry-on case; it’s your must-have travel essential!  Pack it, Pop it, Rock it... Jurni... It's Your Space

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

Find what you want, when you want it!

Jurni has modular, cabinet style storage with an adjustable dividing shelf for maximum flexibility, all of this protected in a durable hard plastic shell. 

Pop it, and Go!

Jurni comes equipped with a portable pod, that can be popped in and out of the suitcase easily on the road, allowing you to keep the essentials close at hand. 


Sit anywhere!

Breeze through queues; sit-on, rock-on or glide-on your Jurni, while immersed in your own world - listening to music, sharing or surfing - you won’t even notice you're waiting around. 

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

Jurni is the only carry-on for teens that’s built for longevity, complete with simple to fit replaceable parts and customised options in the future. 

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

The Next Generation of Connected Travelers

We created Jurni because we want to give teens the independence they crave and the stability they need. Most importantly, we want to give them the room to be themselves,  be it on holiday, while they travel, or staying away from home.

View more images of Jurni in use in the gallery page 

Colours

Available in Fusion Pink, Cobalt Blue and Magma Red, Chose your colour at the end of our campaign.


Photos of Final production samples. 

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

Accessories Perks

We’ve created a custom designed accessories range, perfect for keeping your travel essentials organised and safe. Check out this little video to get a closer look at the unique features of our accessories and see some Jurni packing action!


AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

Specs

Cabin Luggage - Carry-on approved, meets IATA

Dimensions -  20” x 14” x 8” / 50 x 35 x 20 CM

Weight - 7.3 lbs / 3.3 Kg

Capacity – 25 ltr (23 ltr body & 2 ltr pod)

Seat Load – Max seating weight 220 lbs / 100 Kg

Body Material – Impact resistant polypropylene

POD material – Durable plastic composite 

Warranty – 2 years

AVAILABLE TO BUY ONLINE NOW

Design

Good physical product design, is at the heart of Jurni; we didn’t build in electronic gadgets and gizmos, or develop an app – all of which would drive up cost, complexity and become obsolete very quickly. 


We built hundreds of prototypes and ironed out the technical challenges whilst styling its form, to be both streamlined and functional - resulting in a product that is really slick, stylish and intuitive, yet fully ‘manufacturable’.

Check out more product photography on our gallery page 
We collaborated with industry leading engineers to create a super-strong but incredibly light structure; we call it the i-Beam and it's patented design can take up to 220lb (100kg) of sitting load.



Timeline

Jurni is now in production and SHIPPING NOW

Why Indiegogo?

Our founder, Rob Law, launched the Trunki ride-on suitcase on reality TV 10 years ago, but left the Dragons Den (Shark Tank to our American cousins) humiliated and empty handed. However the public saw through it and were hugely supportive, their overwhelming backing has enabled us to sell over 2.8 million Trunki suitcases worldwide. trunki.com

We’ve taken to Indiegogo to launch our second product, Jurni, on a global scale. We really believe consumers have the power to decide what’s a great product and can genuinely help shape its development before it launches. We'd like to harness this power for the launch of Jurni, which aims to bring  the same rewarding experience Trunki gives to travelling tots, but this time to the next generation of travellers.

By backing us on Indiegogo you'll get one of the very first Jurni suitcases! You'll also be able to help us refine future products and together we can ­make any journey a breeze.



Our Jurni team

Our award-winning team has been built up over almost 10 years, we're a design lead business who are extremely passionate about making family travelling easier with our pioneering travel products. We're based in Bristol, England and work from "The Mothership" a converted chapel. The Jurni team are:

Rob Law, CEO Trunki Daddy

An award-winning business leader, Rob’s been pioneering children’s travel gear for 15 years since graduating in Product Design. 


Trevor Bell, Intergalactic Ambassador

With 40 years’ experience in FMCG, Trevor’s 'yoda-like' knowledge helps us navigate global commerce.


Andy Jones, COO Mission Commander 

A business leader with 30 years’ experience in finance and operations with blue chip brands, Andy ensures we run a tight and efficient ship so we can offer the best pricing to you.


Julian Rose Operations Overlord 

An operations and supply chain manager with 15 years’ experience across Asia, North America and Europe, Julian is working tirelessly to hit our shipping timelines.


Joe Allam, Chief Imagineer 

Heading up the design division, Joe has won numerous awards in engineering and design for his products and we're hoping to win some more for Jurni!


Sarah Knight, Graphics Genius

Putting the spark into our creative communications, Sarah is essentially our creative director and has developed the look and feel of the Jurni brand.


Sue Tranter Marketing Astronaut

Our marketing leader with over 25 years of blue chip marketing and brand management experience, Sue is passionate about our pioneering family travel products and wants everyone to know about them.


Melanie Peck Trunki Transmitter 

Our social media manager and marketer, Mel loves helping answer your questions and feeding our social channels with up to date news. Find us at @JurniSocial


Phil Bagnall Digital Demon

Heading up our digital operations, eCommerce and IT systems, Phil loves his tech and keeps us collaborating wherever we are in the world.


Claire Waters Press Pundit

Our PR genius who has been spreading the news about Trunki since the beginning. Mission... maximising Jurni exposure.





Risks and Challenges

We have already invested in full manufacture setup and we've robust experience after producing 2.8 million ride-on suitcases. However, with any new product launch there are always challenges, but we believe we have overcome the most significant ones over our 4 year development period. We've ironed out critical problems at prototype stage and we're currently making minor improvements to tooled injection moulded samples, ready for trial production.

We are currently undergoing rigorous product durability, compliance and safety testing. This could flag up an unforeseen issue which may require further modification to our design. We believe our timeline takes into account minor issues and are confident with our shipping timeline but we can’t exclude needing to make revisions.


FAQs

Where can I buy Jurni?

Were now shipping internationally from www.myjurni.com

What's the upper age limit? 
There is none, however the seat load must not exceed 220 lb (100 kg) 

What's the lower age limit 
We recommend a minimum height of 120 cm so as to maximise stability when sitting or gliding.

How is Jurni up gradable? 
We designed Jurni with upgradability in mind. So to fit spare parts or future upgrades, you can simply unscrew 4 custom bolts inside the Jurni base. This releases the scuff board, which provides access to change the wheels, add a new door,  and a new telescopic handle. The scuff board can get worn with heavy use so its easily replaced too!

Is the Pod waterproof? 
It's light shower-proof. If using in heavy rain, keep electronics in a water tight place. 

What tablets fit in the Pod? 
Designed to fit an iPad mini, the Pod’s internal width is 10.2” (L) x 5.3” (W) x 2.3” (H) : 260mm x 135mm x 59mm , do check the width of your tablet

Can Jurni be checked in? 
It's designed to be used as hand luggage, however it can only be checked in using the Jurni check in strap, available for purchase separately.

Why is there not a charger built in? 
If we built in a charger, it would cost several times more than buying one on the open market and it's highly likely you already own a portable charger, plus they can become obsolete quickly with better capacity ones coming out constantly! Most portable chargers will easily fit in the quick access pod.

Does Jurni come with a guarantee (warranty)?

Jurni will come with a 2 year guarantee (warranty).


CAMPAIGN QUESTIONS:

How can I contact your team?

If you have any questions about Jurni, please email us on hello@myjurni.com or use the comments section on Indiegogo.

When can I choose my colour preference?

You can choose your Jurni colour preference once the Indiegogo campaign finishes. You will receive an email from our team asking you to select the colour of your choice. 

When is Jurni shipping?

Jurni is SHIPPING NOW please allow upto 10 working days to process the order, alternatively buy from www.myjurni.com

How can I get a refund?

Refunds can be processed directly on Indiegogo within 10 days of the contribution, after than place contact hello@myjurni.com

story:
Howdy! My name is Mike Johnson, but you can call me MJ. I am the oldest of 7 brothers and was born and raised in the Washington DC area. I am a 33 year old professional IT Guy and entrepreneur, and this is just one of many ideas I want to share with you.

I came up with the idea for the Mummie Blanket about 2 years ago and have spent the last 24 months sourcing materials, getting prototypes made, and working with US based manufacturers to get the product ready for sale. We sourced high quality fleece and are having the blankets HAND MADE in the USA to ensure that we are delivering a top notch product.

Now that all that work is done I need your help. Without the money to get the materials in bulk and place a large manufacturing order, it will be many months (maybe years) before I am able to get the first manufacturing run completed. Buying the materials in large quantities and placing a large inital manufacturing order will make sure that we can provide the best price to the folks who purchase the Mummie Blanket.

About the Mummie Blanket

  • Hand Made in the USA from High Quality Fleece
  • Mummie Flap provides privacy while feeding
  • Behind-The-Neck snaps ensure the blanket stays in place
  • Pocket for Binky, Phone, Burp Cloth Etc.
  • Colors: Red and Blue (more colors coming in the future)

What We Need & What You Get

To put it simply, we need $20,000 to fund the inital manufacturing run of the Mummie Blankets.

Breakdown:

$5K for company setup, website design costs, sales and marketing costs and part time employee salaries

$7500 for the initial bulk purchase of the materials for the first run of blankets

$7500 for the manufacturing costs of the initial order of blankets

We have come up with a few rewards for contributors so make sure you check out all the perks! Any help towards this goal would be a huge help and greatly appreciated!

The Impact of Your Contribution

The Snu**ie company has proven that the world loves the sleeved blanket. They have made many variations of their sleeved blanket but we are the only ones targeting new mothers. Many of you probably know one or two women who are expecting, and for those who plan to breastfeed, the Mummie Blanket would make a great gift that is not only functional, but also very unique.

The Mummie Blanket is an innovative product that I firmly believe would be highly welcomed by breastfeeding moms. The pocket on the side of the Mummie Blanket also helps mothers stay organized by providing a place to keep a cell phone and baby's binky or burp cloth close at hand.

Your contributions will help this innovative product get manufactured so that breastfeeding moms everywhere can have a comfortable and private breastfeeding experience.

If you can help us reach our goal we promise to continue to innovate and and make our products better and more affordable. 

We appreciate any support, even if you can't give money. A Facebook share, a tweet or an email about the Mummie Blanket to someone who might be interested would be a massive help. Make sure you take advantage of the IndieGoGo share tools as well!

Thanks so much in advance and please email us at info@mummieblanket.com with ANY questions, comments or concerns.

Now that all that work is done I need your help. Without the money to get the materials in bulk and place a large manufacturing order, it will be many months (maybe years) before I am able to get the first manufacturing run completed. Buying the materials in large quantities and placing a large inital manufacturing order will make sure that we can provide the best price to the folks who purchase the Mummie Blanket.
About the Mummie Blanket

Hand Made in the USA from High Quality Fleece
Mummie Flap provides privacy while feeding
Behind-The-Neck snaps ensure the blanket stays in place
Pocket for Binky, Phone, Burp Cloth Etc.
Colors: Red and Blue (more colors coming in the future)
What We Need & What You Get
To put it simply, we need $20,000 to fund the inital manufacturing run of the Mummie Blankets.
Breakdown:
$5K for company setup, website design costs, sales and marketing costs and part time employee salaries
$7500 for the initial bulk purchase of the materials for the first run of blankets
$7500 for the manufacturing costs of the initial order of blankets
We have come up with a few rewards for contributors so make sure you check out all the perks! Any help towards this goal would be a huge help and greatly appreciated!
The Impact of Your Contribution
The Snu**ie company has proven that the world loves the sleeved blanket. They have made many variations of their sleeved blanket but we are the only ones targeting new mothers. Many of you probably know one or two women who are expecting, and for those who plan to breastfeed, the Mummie Blanket would make a great gift that is not only functional, but also very unique.
The Mummie Blanket is an innovative product that I firmly believe would be highly welcomed by breastfeeding moms. The pocket on the side of the Mummie Blanket also helps mothers stay organized by providing a place to keep a cell phone and baby's binky or burp cloth close at hand.
Your contributions will help this innovative product get manufactured so that breastfeeding moms everywhere can have a comfortable and private breastfeeding experience.
If you can help us reach our goal we promise to continue to innovate and and make our products better and more affordable. 
We appreciate any support, even if you can't give money. A Facebook share, a tweet or an email about the Mummie Blanket to someone who might be interested would be a massive help. Make sure you take advantage of the IndieGoGo share tools as well!
Thanks so much in advance and please email us at info@mummieblanket.com with ANY questions, comments or concerns.

story:
God has been so gracious and you have been so GENEROUS!  We have hit our initial goal of $3000! 

Which means: WE OFFICIALLY WILL RECEIVE EVERY DONATION GIVEN because we hit our goal in the set time! *see explanation of fixed funding further down

Now its on to our second goal of $4000 total.

Our collective trip total is $5700.  We set our initial goal low so that we would be able to make it (yay!) but we are only half way there to funding our whole trip! 

Everything you continue to contribute over the initial goal still comes to us and still helps us meet our total trip goal!   Help us race the clock and meet $4000!



Support Michelle and Missy on their Compassion Trip to Trinidad! 

What are we doing?

We are helping to establish a Green Cross Crisis Center in Trinidad with Regent’s Trauma Team!  For two weeks in July, we will be traveling with an awesome team of professors and students to Trinidad to offer trauma counseling to those in prisons, orphanages, and those living on the streets. We also will be training local leadership in crisis and trauma support to be able to respond to national crises and disasters like the Haiti earthquake.

Why we need you?

We are looking for teammates to partner on this awesome journey with us!  We can not do this alone and truly believe that your partnership will help make a difference in Trinidad. We are looking for donors to come alongside us both prayerfully and financially.  Anything helps from $10 to $1000 :)  Plus you get some pretty sweet perks :)

What do the funds go to?

The total sum of our collective trip is $5700, but we are starting with a goal of raising $3000. Why you ask? Because this platform is a fixed funding campaign, meaning we do not receive any funds unless we hit our goal 100%. Scary but an exciting risk.So we wanted to start small and work our way up!  And we only have 30 days to do it! 

If we do hit $3000 within the timeframe, our next goal will be another $1000 ($4000 total). If we hit that we will go for the total sum of $5700!

Donations given go completely to trips costs which cover team supplies, training materials, lodging, local transportation and airfare. Donations are securely collected via credit cards or PayPal Accounts.


The Vision:

What exactly will we be doing during our two weeks in Trinidad?
We will be doing two main things
1. Establish a Green Cross Crisis Center  (trainings)
The Green Cross is the trauma/mental health version of the Red Cross.  They respond to natural disasters and local community crises around the world. The Green Cross says "the mission is to transform victims into survivors."  Like Haiti, Trinidad is susceptible to much of the same natural disasters.  That coupled with an impoverished infrastructure makes Trinidad particular vulnerable to crisis.  Our hope and plan is to partner with the local officials and the community in establishing Trinidad's first Green Cross center. We will be training officials during these two weeks, equipping them to be prepared for potential threats.  Our plan is to leave behind a fully functional Green Cross center to the benefit of Trinidad.
2. Counseling individuals affected by trauma:
Missy and Michelle have been taking specialized training in trauma and crisis counseling (classes such psychological first aid, traumatized families and children, and grief and loss) since last fall. All with the aim of preparing for this trip and becoming certified Traumatologists.  We will be going on site to locations such as prisons, orphanages, and inner city community centers in Trinidad. We will be counseling those affected by trauma such as  domestic violence, sexual abuse, crime, etc in both group and individual settings.

story:
Hey everyone, 

I've been considering doing this for some time now. Is it okay to fundraise for yourself? It seems very much against societal norms. If you disagree with my little personal campaign, then it's fine, I won't be offended. But I thought I would go ahead and ask for help nonetheless. 

Here's the deal: I need a new insulin pump! Insulin pumps cost $7000 or $7700 if you want it to monitor your blood glucose as well as give you insulin. I have health coverage; YAY! But my plan will only cover so much! $5600 to be exact. This leaves me, an individual who doesn't have thousands of dollars of pocket change, to pay the remaining $2100. Yikes!

Soo, I thought that I would ask my friends and family if anyone wanted to pitch in anything at all for my own personal charity. Unfortunately I cannot give an income tax receipt. I would gladly accept any donation no matter what size. It doesn't seem right to ask for help, but I'm hoping that maybe my fundraising over $10,000 in the past for other charities will help give me some good karma towards my own need?

Thank you all so much in advance!

In love & friendship,
Maddi

 

**Pleas note that I have made my goal $2200 only to cover some of the admin fees.

story:
In January of 2012 I set off from Edinburgh in Scotland with the aim of walking around the world to reach its antipodal point of Dunedin in New Zealand. This journey will take me across 3 continents, through 15 countries and over 20,000 km.

Born in a small village in the west of Ireland in the early eighties, I've always had a desire to expand my horizons and explore the world around me. The idea of travelling to my own antipodal point has always fascinated me. I have often wondered not only what it would be like to reach this point that simultaneously exists on the other side of the world, but also what I would experience, discover and learn on my journey there. The places I would see, the cultures I would encounter and the stories I would hear and then be able to pass on. This challenge gives me that unique opportunity to frame the world around me and press record. Throughout this journey I will contiune to document through photography this experience and the lives of those I encounter along my way. I also endevour to keep people up to date about my progress, daily through Twitter and Facebook and through my blog on my website www.justgoingforastroll.com  

So far on this journey I have completed over 2,650 km. Walking through Scotland, England, The Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Slovakia and Hungary in just four months. But I still have a long road ahead of me. I will continue along the Danube to Belgrade and through central Serbia to Sofia in Bulgaria before leaving Europe behind and crossing the Bosphorus into Asia at Istanbul in the next two months. In the second half of my first year on foot, I will continue through Turkey, crossing the Turkish  mountains of Kurdistan on to Iran.  I will then continue through the deserts of Iran and Pakistan, reaching India by the end of this year.

The beginning of the second year of my walk will then take me across the Indian subcontintent and along the Ganges river to Kolkata where I will use local water transport to cross the Bay of Bengal and the Andaman Sea to take up the trek again in Indonesia. I will then continue my trip through the rainforests of Sumatra and rice fields and coffee plantations of Java before crossing the Timor Sea to reach Australia. In this penultimate leg of the journey I will walk across the Australian desert to reach the Sunshine Coast and Brisbane. The challenge picks up again in Auckland on the north island of New Zealand where I, having now traveled almost 19,000km, will then walk along the 1,000km coast until I reach my final destination, and anitpodal point of Edinburgh, Dunedin.

What I Need

Up until now this expedition has been almost entirely funded by myself.  In order to finance my trek in combination with my life savings I sold everything I owned to help make this journey a possibility. But that will only get me so far.

If you would like to help me make this journey, be it a company or an individual, there are many ways in which you can provide support.  From providing food and lodging to equipment or financial support for the bureaucratic costs of the trip. Any help you could provide would be much appreciated.

The Impact

I did not want this journey to be only about me wanting to fulfill a personal challenge. It is also important to me to find a way to benefit others so, along the way I'm raising money and awareness for the worlds leading childrens charity UNICEF.  I talk to schools, universities, faith groups, communities, politicians and the press, encouraging them not just to donate their money but also their time to those less fortunate than themselves.

I'm a UNICEF volunteer and therefore recieve no payment from UNICEF for this challenge. All donations made on Indiegogo go towards assisting me with my costs. With your help I will be able to continue my journey and spread UNICEF's message.  If you would like to donate to UNICEF then you can do so through my UNICEF fundraising page where 100% of your donations there go directly to UNICEF.

Other Ways You Can Help

- Share this page on the web!!

- Follow and share my experience on my justgoingforastroll Facebook & Twitter pages.

- Follow the trip on my website www.justgoingforastroll.com and... share, share, share!!
 
Thank you for your help and support.

story:
Travels are supposed to be enjoyable, so why bother to struggle with those inferior pillows and miss the landscapes with regrets.

You need a neck pillow that can leave these worries behind and

make your journey count.

 

 

Let’s check out how Alpha Pillow is inflated!

It is energy-saving. Inflate your pillow with only ONE breath. Blow towards the large opening, and the funnel-like film will collect all your breath at once. Also the magnetic seal ensures no air slip away. Then push and roll up the magnetic seal to get the pillow firm and set. It’s time to say goodbye to leakage.

It is hygienic. Instead of taking mouth-to-mouth inflation with a valve, the way of inflating Alpha Pillow keeps you away from any health risks caused by contact. Open and hold the seal away with your mouth, blow air into the pillow, no more contact with the valves.


The two arms in unequal length after inflation allows you to set up a phone holder on the longer arm in the middle, which ensures the most favorable distance for watching a movie.
Sit back and relax while your favorite pillow takes care of entertainment during your trip.

 

 

Your Alpha Pillow can become a desk pillow
during your naptime.

After a busy morning, your body needs some energy recharging. Alpha Pillow can help you take a more efficient rest. Gently place it on the table surface, squeeze the longer arm downward to let it support your chest, then just fall asleep with your pillow. The patented design can alleviate the numbness and pain caused by the hard edges of the table.

 

The breathable pillowcase makes it even more comfortable!

Put on the Lycra pillowcase for a more comfortable rest experience. The ice silk texture of the pillowcase allows you to feel the softest and the smoothest contact with the pillow. The breathability of the pillowcase ensures your personal hygiene. Have it cleaned by detaching the pillowcase and throwing it into the washing machine.

 

 

Ultimate comfort with the smart ergonomic design!

The slim design of the supportive part for your neck can decrease the pressure posed on your back neck and your cervical spine, which provides you with customized comfort. Two thick arms of the pillow, which you can hold with your arms crossed can offer you a sense of security during the journey.

Deflation is as easy as the process of inflation.

When you want to deflate the pillow, just open the seal and pull out the thin film, and press the pillow from one side to another to let the air escape. Then, you can put everything together, and store it in the bag, which is super compact to carry with.

 

Yes, Alpha Pillow can be repaired.

If your Alpha Pillow is accidentally punctured, there’s no need to panic. After you deflate the pillow, you can turn it inside out. Find where the puncture or cut is and attach a “self-adhesive” pad to it. Turn it back, and it looks no different from the original one. All is done! Nice and easy.

Alpha Pillow is a real multifunctional pillow.

In addition to the functionalities as a personal neck pillow, a stable phone holder and a comfortable desk pillow, there are a sleep mask and a pair of earplugs that ensure you obtain tranquility and peace during your rests. It is so versatile that can meet your needs of using it in different scenarios.

Choose your favorite color from Grey, Green, Blue, Purple & Orange.

 

 

Looking for something different?

YOU GOT IT!

Unlock new colors for your Alpha Pillow with special designer’s picks.
The trendiest designs in 2021.

Hi, I’m the designer of Alpha Pillow. Having noticed various problems in the recent travel pillow market, I decided to design a multifunctional neck pillow for travelers, white-collar workers and anybody who may need it. I have rich experience in designing various kinds of inflatable products, including inflatable couch, inflatable chair and air mattress. One of these products was “the top 1 product of sale” of French Amazon Prime Day 2017. Alpha Pillow is a thoughtful present that I hope will bring comfort and convenience to you.

We are EasierHike and we are the manufacturer of Alpha Pillow. By cooperating with talented designers, we have produced various outdoor sports equipment which is broadly welcomed by the market. Our brand concept is based on “Making Travel Easier”, and we advocate that outdoor activities should adhere to the notion of being environmentally-friendly, comfortable, stylish and convenient. Alpha Pillow is one of our favorite products, and we hope you may also favor it as we do.

The purpose of running an Indiegogo campaign is that we understand what problems our customers are facing with travel pillows, and we hope to produce one that may eliminate these pain points in the travel pillow market. We found out that traditional inflatable pillows require users to make direct contact with the inflating valve, which may arouse great concern during the COVID-19 pandemic period, and it always costs users a very long time to fully inflate the pillow through the valves. Therefore, we are committed to producing a neck pillow that can be easily inflated but is also contactless. Moreover, we want to design a neck pillow that can fit in various scenarios, rather than for a journey merely. So, Alpha Pillow is designed with multifunctionality which can be used during your travel, in your office or at home.
