story:
52 SPEAKER is the ultimate bluetooth speaker for you, cycling lovers! With a tuned and high-quality sound optimized for outdoor environments, 52 SPEAKER can be easily and firmly mounted on a handle, stem, or top tube of your bike. On any bike you ride: roadbike, mountain bike, hybrid bike, fixie, minivelo, classic bike or dutch bike, 52 SPEAKER will make your ridings more stylish!

 It is proven by countless studies that listening to your favorite jams can make your ride more fun, intense, and fast. Science has shown that music decreases perceived exertion, elevates energy levels, and increases endurance.

However, utilizing headsets or earphones can bring these joys of riding into a dangerous hault. With a maximum average volume of 105 decibels and talking volume of 40-60 decibels, it is difficult to be safely aware of your surroundings. The sounds from the car speeding forward from the behind and the motorcycle passing by are unable to be heard. In many countries including eight states in the U.S., wearing headphones/earphones while riding is illegal.

52 SPEAKER confidently allows you to safely and legally listen to your favorite tracks. 52 SPEAKER is mountable onto your handlebars to serenade your cycling trips. The volume is perfect for riding while still being cognizant of your surroundings and being courteous to fellow riders. (In a crowd, use common sense and turn the volume down unless your neighbors ask you to turn it up!)

52 SPEAKER can be attached in various positions on your bike with a holding mount and rubber rings, which are included in the box. It is firmly fixed only by placing and rotating, and detachment is just as simple. If you already have a GARMIN mount on your bike, you can also mount 52 SPEAKER directly on it with its compatible rear structure.

The iconic control keys of 52 SPEAKER are designed for your convenience. Improving tactility and discriminability of the buttons of existing portable speakers, 52 SPEAKER can be controlled with gloved hands and even when you keep your eyes forwards. You can play, pause, and control the volume of the music, or move to next or previous songs seamlessly.

                  

Inspired by a hip flask, 52 SPEAKER boasts a sleek streamlined design with big buttons and a dial knob that are easily discriminable with fingers. 52 SPEAKER is small and light, enhancing tactility to make it optimized for outdoor activities.

When we thought of the concept of a flask bottle, we knew we wanted to incorporate aspects of its design into 52 SPEAKER. People carry typically around hip flasks for convenience to drink beverages and enjoy leisurely time during their journeys. This theme matched the concept of 52 SPEAKER and what we wanted it to represent.

I’m a bike rider. I know how much joy and energy that music can add to my bike riding adventures. I’ve searched for a handy, mountable speaker that I could use but could not find one. They were too large, too bulky, or too complicated to attach on my bike. So I decided to make a small, compacted bike speaker that I myself would want to use.

I’m also a product designer. I’ve designed and successfully introduced sound systems, TVs, and monitors to the market while working at SAMSUNG, but I've always wanted to make a sleek and advanced product on my own terms. After lots of trials and errors for two years, 52 SPEAKER has now been finalized in the manufacturing process and is preparing for mass production. This campaign's funding is for our full-out kickoff of mass production.

Now we are TEAM 52. Starting with 52 SPEAKER, we look forward to continuously introducing groundbreaking products under the theme “Our Precious 52 Weekends”. We hope 52 SPEAKER will ensure that all of your 52 weekends (in a year) are blissful and memorable.

52 SPEAKER has two sound modes. In ACTIVITY mode, you can enjoy enhanced, crisp sound tuned for noisy and windy outdoor riding environment. In NORMAL mode, you can enjoy rich, deep sound suitable for general, everyday use.

 Turn on Google's voice navigation for traffic alerts and directions on-the-go

Water and Dust Resistance  52 SPEAKER is water and dust resistant. 52 SPEAKER is made of premium materials and has a strong and sleek casing made with anodized aluminum grill and durable polymer.

Long-lasting Battery  With a 750mAh built-in rechargeable lithium polymer battery, 52 SPEAKER has up to 7 hours of music playback. Let 52 SPEAKER join you on your long-winded journeys.

Hands-free call  When you receive a call to a paired mobile phone, click the main button, and 52 SPEAKER will become a speakerphone for your call. No need to take your mobile phone out of your pocket, Converse on 52 SPEAKER's high sensitivity built-in microphone!

FM radio mode  FM radio mode to brighten up the mood. With auto scanning and channel memory functions, you can directly access the radio channels you want to hear.

ACTIVITY / NORMAL Modes  52 SPEAKER has two sound modes. In ACTIVITY mode, you can enjoy enhanced, crisp sound tuned for noisy outdoor environments. In NORMAL mode, you can enjoy rich, deep sound suitable for general, everyday use.

story:
Mission Nicaragua 2014

This April, 40 high school aged boys and girls will travel with the Legionaries of Christ to one of our traditional mission territories: Chinandega, Nicaragua!  This is our 3rd annual mission trip, and each trip has been a life-changing experience for all those who have participated.  We will have the opportunity to help the local priest as well as the local townspeople, bringing them the joy of Christ and our hard work to show our love for them.

We need your support!

In order to make this mission trip a success, we first and foremost ask you for your prayers.

We are also looking to raise $5,000 in order to accomplish the following:

  • $3,400
    • Help fix up, paint, and remodel a local orphanage where many young kids live and are currently awaiting to be adopted.
  • $1,000
    • Remodeling project for the unwed mothers' home.  We need to fix many of the toilets and beds, as well as purchase new sheets for many of the rooms.
  • $600
    • Putting on a carnival for kids that live in the trash dump (food, games, prizes, etc.)

Thank you so much for helping us help make a difference!!  You can be assured of our prayers and only God can repay you for your generosity!

$3,400Help fix up, paint, and remodel a local orphanage where many young kids live and are currently awaiting to be adopted.

$1,000Remodeling project for the unwed mothers' home.  We need to fix many of the toilets and beds, as well as purchase new sheets for many of the rooms.

$600Putting on a carnival for kids that live in the trash dump (food, games, prizes, etc.)

Thank you so much for helping us help make a difference!!  You can be assured of our prayers and only God can repay you for your generosity!

story:
I wrote a song, y’all, called “Never Let Go.” And I want to give it to you. But I also want something from you.

If you’re reading this, you probably know me. You probably know that the last few years have been a time of wrestling with God and reclaiming the hope and freedom and fullness he provides. These days, I’m breathless with the knowledge that God could go that low with me and bring me to such a new and beautiful place. I make no apologies for my past because I have a Father who redeemed me and calls me by a new name, Beloved. It turns out the drudgery of yesterday and today is actually quite extraordinary, the moments never mistakes. Freedom does exist and it is for the faint of heart.

See I wrote this song about all of the above, and I didn’t know what to do with it. But now I do. The last few years have brought about some new passions I didn’t have before. Like loving the least of these (Matthew 25), remembering the needy (Psalm 9), and caring for the fatherless (Deuteronomy 10:18, James 1). I think about how much Jesus has done for me; I’m compelled to participate with him in doing that for others. Don’t worry, I’ve been working on loving people I regularly encounter, and I love to love locally. But I’m ready to reach farther. So my church, Cross Point (www.crosspoint.tv) is sending a team to India, November 3-12, 2014. We will be working with SEED (Save, Entrust, Equip, Disciple) in Calcutta. The goal of the work there is to adopt communities and love them like they’re our family. We’ll provide resources and opportunities so the people there can get themselves out of poverty. We’ll do work in two communities – Khalpar (a slum) and Katapukur (a village).

I want you to help me be a part of that team. In return for helping me get to India, I want you to have that song I mentioned, “Never Let Go.” 

I have a total of $2,700 to raise for the trip itself, in addition to $150 for shots and my visa, bringing the total to $2,850. Anything made over $2,850 will contribute to local ministry here in Nashville! If you donate, you will automatically receive a digital copy of "Never Let Go", regardless of the donation amount. Want to help a sista out? Or maybe you’d just like to purchase the song. That money will also go toward getting me to India (to download: http://neverletgo.info/2013/11/16/post-3/). But maybe you can’t support financially at all. No worries. Could you spread the word and/or pray for this endeavor? Every bit matters.

Thank you if you made it through this whole post! Thank you in advance for supporting my trip to India! I’m so ready to love on some people & let them know their lives matter. Saying ‘yes’ to God is scary, but so fun. Thank you thank you thank you for sharing in this journey with me!

Love,
Chels

story:
Every need or convenience that we have in life today usually stems from a problem or an inconvenience one might say, mine personally was a big one.  In 2010 I woke to a pain in my mid back 

T-7 vertebrae to be exact. Not too much pain at first but it was annoying and more noticeable as time when on I decided to go to a Chiropractor when conventional medicine was not doing the trick.

I told mentioned the problem (T-7 pain) and he quickly wrenched my body around including my neck and explained it as, (you need your whole body adjusted for this to work.)  The next day I woke with a feeling  like a golf ball in the throat.  It felt very uncomfortable and quickly turned to pain and I mean pain!  uncontrollable level 10 pain!
 
I want to get to the point but this is important for potential backers to hear.  I spent 18 months with this pain level , $5000.00 on doctors, had every test done under the sun!  Nothing took the pain away and no Doctor could ever tell me what was wrong. I refused to take any heavy pain killers or drugs because I do not believe in masking pain,  I believe in healing it.

At this moment I was almost at the point of no return, could not work could barely think straight When my Brother came to me with this project he was working on for jet engines at Allied Technologies it  seemed that they needed bright light to see certain moving pieces in the engine.  He had this Laser device he had made. He mentioned to me that it had benefits for pain although he designed it for pointing. I used it for about 15 minutes a day.  Now remember Nothing has worked for me NOTHING! The first few days I felt little to no change but By the third day 45 minutes total use I woke up feeling at least 50% better.  I was so freaked out I took the thing and used it for 45 minute sessions for one week. After $5000.00 in doctor bills no so called expert in the field of medicine never mentioned this?  NEWS FLASH I HAD 9TH CRANIAL NERVE DAMAGE AND THE LASER REPAIRED THE NERVES!

An Image of our First Red LED Laser


Now the best part

After one week I had ZERO pain!  Yes Zero.  You can not imagine how I felt and have felt ever since, back in the gym working on my many projects again.  As I used this laser I noticed something else it was doing, It was tightening my skin to a point where I was looking much younger, the laser takes wrinkles right off your face. Then I started to become sort of an advocate for what is called soft laser light and the effects on the Human Body.

Then it hit me Why not try to get the word, out take our crude laser, Give it a face lift and  mass produce it,  We want a soft laser in the hands of everyone! That is why we need your help.  We ask you ,If we could put one of these in your hands (with benefits We will explain of course) for less then dinner for two at a family restaurant would you back us? Well if you said yes keep reading below and we will explain exactly what we are offering backers for this campaign. We have plans to open a factory And use R&D to design a full Led Bed Like a tanning bed but instead of damaging your cells Our bed will be total body rejuvenation, along with many other projects to bring Cold laser main stream without the expense of clinical visits

We are using all funding for creation and Distribution. Backers will receive very special price before launch Please read Below to realize the miracle of LED Soft Laser Light
Thank you for reading
Thomas

Benefits of Red Light (660mn) & Infrared Light(850nm)
Penetrates tissues to a depth of 8-10mm helps blood circulation, enhance immunity, stimulate metabolism, produces
new collagen fivefold in the skin, triggering repair and stimulating cells and cell growth (The red and Infrared are what healed me. We are going to be able to add attachments to our laser with different light each having it's own benefit please read what the Blue, Yellow and Green Light are used for below.



Blue LED Treatment (415nm blue LED Light)
Kills acne causing bacteria, reduces inflammation and provides a rejuvenation effect on the skin. Blue light therapy tightens pours and decreases oiliness by regulating
sebum produced by the sebacecous glands 




Yellow LED treatment (570nm yellow LED light)
Improves microcirculation and regulates cell activity yellow light is completely absorbed by the cells repairing problems caused by aging. 




Green LED treatment (525nm Green LED Light)
reduces discoloration in the skin, freckles, sun damage,
age spots, lightens pigmentation, improves skin tone in general.  


REMEMBER ALL THESE ARE DETACHABLE HEADS THE PROVIDE A DIFFERENT BENEFIT!   This is not some fancy campaign done by an expensive marketing group

it is just Us believing in what we do!

We want to go from this

TO THIS!

We can only make this a viable business plan and reality with Help from you

We hope you find the perks well worth it for your support



LETS START HEALING!!!!

story:
Short Summary

Invisible Borders Trans-African Photographic Initiative is an art-led initiative, founded in Nigeria in 2009 by passionate Nigerian artists – mostly photographers – with a drive and urge to effect change in the society. It was registered in 2011 under the Cooperate Affairs Commission (CAC) of Nigeria as Invisible Borders Trans-African Photographers Organisation. The vision of the initiative is to become a symbol of networking and trans-border associations within the arts and photography in Africa, but also to become a stepping-stone platform for young immerging talents in the continent in such a way that it creates a breeding ground for young artist to be thinking beyond borders at the beginning stage of their creative quest.

Our mission is to tell Africa’s stories, by Africans, through photography and inspiring artistic interventions; to encourage exposure of upcoming African photographers towards art and photography as practiced in other parts of the continent.; to establish a platform that encourages and embraces trans- African artistic relationships within the continent, and to contribute towards the socio-political discourse shaping Africa of the 21st Century.

Our goal is to constantly spread and share knowledge and information, cutting across the demarcating lines of classes and proficiency in literacy, thereby expanding the art public to include more of the local audience and the “layman”.

 The main activity /project of the Initiative since its foundation has been The Invisible Borders Trans-African Road Trip Project. Every year,  up to ten artists - photographers, writers, flimmakers and art historians come together to embark on a road trip across Africa to explore and participate in various photographic events, festival and exhibitions while engaging on a daily basis with the environment and the people encountered. The emphasis is primarily on the collective journey of the participating artists who, during their momentary stops in capital cities, create photographic, video and textual works that often reflect their individual approach to engaging with local artists, art practitioners and the inhabitants. During the trip, we maintain a daily blog by which we share a glimpse of the experiences of the road trip with our numerous followers all over the world.

We are dedicated to creating works, which portray the dynamism, richness as well as contradictions of the various modes of existence of the African people. In doing this, they reject a simplified notion of Africa nor a tidy definition of it, but instead hopes to create an archive of works which “complicates” the depiction of contemporary Africa, one which sees the continent as work-in-progress, rather than a foregone conclusion

 We  therefore see the Invisible Borders Road trip as a workshop of artistic creation and a performative social intervention all rolled into one. Moreover it offers that unique experience of “learning in motion” and discovering oneself through interactions with diverse encounters by constantly altering one’s own reality through constant movement.

 So far there has been three editions of the road trip. The first edition was in 2009 with ten participants: nine photographers, and a writer who travelled from Lagos, Nigeria to Bamako Mali with stops in Benin, Ghana, Togo and Burkina Fasso. In 2010, the group travelled with ten participants from Lagos to Dakar and in 2011, from Lagos to Addis Ababa. All the three editions have been well documented in a blog. After the trips the workshops, conferences and exhibitions were organized in Bamako (2009), Lagos (2009 and 2010), Abuja (2010), Dakar (2010), Addis Ababa (2010), Bern Museum Switzerland (2010), Berlin (April2011), New York (2012) where the outcome and experiences of the two editions were shared with the public and students.

This year, we are gearing up for the 4th edition of the Road Trip project. This year includes artists from Nigeria, South Africa, Rwanda,Mozambique and Congo DR. We will travel from Lagos, Nigeria to Lubumbashi, Congo DR spending 49 days on the trip. The project is scheduled for the 23rd of August through the 9th of October 2012. This journey will prove to be an ardous one with lots of rough terrains and some 13,000 kilometres to crunch. We are ever determined to achieve this and bring home with us countless experiences which will benefit anyone who would want to make similar trips in the future. Therefore if you are passioante about the continent of Africa and the myriad stories yet untold then our project is worth the support and this will go a long way to make the project a success.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We do have some funds from a few organizations, but what we have so far is not enough to cater for our expense during the trip. We need an additional 20,000 USD in order to be where we need to be financially. If you donate towards our project, you will be contributing towards the cost of transportation, feeding and accomodation of the artists during the 49 days of the road trip project. Also you will help ensure that we have enough money to take care of some contingent situation which from experience is usally the case with these trips. Traveling by road in Africa is about improvisation and being prepared to deal with unforeseen circumstances, and a big part of this has to do with having adequate funds. 

Oh yes! we do have something to give back in return, depending on the amount you contribute. From making your name available on the "Individuals in Collaboration" section of our website, to giving out unique Invisible Borders 2012 T-shirts, up to publishing your name as a crowd funder in the very first Invisible Borders Coffee Table book scheduled to be launched in May 2013. We will also give out collector's copies of the book to our generous contributors. But that's not all, We will also give signed collectors photo print from the 2012 edition of the Trip. 

Even if we don't meet the 20,000 USD mark, whatever we get will go a long way to help in the project. It might prove to be much more challenging than we had envisaged. We may have to sleep in shabby hotels and sometimes in our van, but in the least our vehicle wil have enough gas and oil to carry us all the way to and fro! 

The Impact

Your contribution will help keep the campaign of No Borders by our initiative alive, and to promote Trans-African exchanges. Moreover in making these road trip, we are presenting the world with alternatives to the stories and media representation of the Continent. We aslo believe that we are propagating knowledge that is needed for the transformation and development of the continent. We are sensitising the minds of Africans of our generation to become proactive as regards issues saddling the continent. 

 The results of the past three editions are that eleven emerging photographers and three writers have gained first national/international exposure, and that the website, the blog, and the follow-up workshops are gradually becoming a strong resource and database for art researchers, and interested collaborators. It has also commenced an “Image Bank project”, in order to make available all the images to users across the continent and the world at large. We have also earned the partnership of reputable organizations and firms such as Canon Europe (who gave us cameras and video equipment), HIVOS, Institut Francais, New Museum of New York, Prince Claus, the Ministry of culture of Mali, Embassy of Nigeria in Addis Ababa, Art Moves Africa, and Museum of Modern Arts Addis Ababa, etc.

We have also had media coverage from New York Times, Jeune Afrique Afrique France and numerous online blogs. Please feel free to go on google to learn more about the project.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

if you cannot donate, not to worry, you can help by spreading the word! Please like our Facebook page and share the link around so that you friends can follow as well. 

follow us on Twitter as well

Or write us if you would like to subscribe to our mailing list: info@invisible-borders.com

Don't forget to look up our website: www.invisible-borders.com 

Thank you!

story:
*** UPDATE 29 OCT, 2012:

3/4 of the way through with my campaign and it doesn't look good:( I've done everything I can to promote the Pet Cooling System, but unless there are a lot more contributors, it's not going to become a reality in the next five years. Over 1,000 people have viewed this campaign, and I still have not gotten any feedback as to why people don't want to support this. If YOU decide that you do not want to contribute PLEASE leave me a comment and let me know why.  Thanks.

 

My name is Troy Hawkins, from Boise, Idaho.  I’m asking for your help to make a pet safety invention of mine a reality.  I need to raise $40,000 in order to hire an engineering design firm to construct a prototype and conduct product testing. This is the lowest of four quotes I have recieved. With a working prototype, I will be able to either sell my invention or raise the necessary capital to manufacture them myself.

At this point, I have reached the limits of my financial resources, as well as my engineering skills. I need professionals to complete my work by determining the right materials to use, calculate power usage and heat transfer and refining the manufacturing process. Then it's on to testing to make sure that the Pet Cooling System is durable, long-lasting and maintenance free,

For your $5 contribution, I am going to send you ten e-books. These are great references to use for dog training, understanding behavior and canine nutrition. Use them yourself or give them to someone you know who is getting a dog or puppy for the first time.  Most are easy to read and understandable by children, so they make terrific gifts for new pet parents.

About my invention:

  • Helps your dog regulate body temperature.
  • Prevents heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
  • Can be used anywhere there's power, or for up to one hour on the internal battery.
  • Requires no maintainence from the owner, beyond washing the cover.
  • Safe, non-toxic materials.
  • You know that your pet always has a safe, cool spot, even if your A/C breaks or power goes out.

You've probably noticed that your dog likes to lay on cool surfaces that draw away excess heat. Even if you feel comfortable, your dog wouldn't mind it being a few degrees cooler. Hence, the Pet Cooling System. It gives your pet a cool, comfortable place to lay down, that is going to remain cool. Your pet doesn't have to get up and find a new spot after the old one warms up. No more tripping over your dog on a middle of the night bathroom run. Use it outside and your pet won't need to dig up your flower beds to find cool dirt to lay on. Put it in the bedroom, family or living room and your dog can have it's own comfortably cool spot near the people it loves. The Pet Cooling System contains an internal rechargeable battery, so even if the power goes out while you're away from home, you have the piece of mind knowing that your beloved pet still has a safe and cool spot in the house without the air conditioning running.

The Pet Cooling System is made up of four components. 

  1. The Control Unit: Using existing, proven cooling technology, the Control Unit continuously chills and circulates water and air. It contains the rechargeable battery and temperature controls.
  2. The Cooling Pad: This 4’ x 2’ pad contains tubing that the chilled water circulates through. When your pet lays on the Cooling Pad, heat is drawn out of its body and carried back to the Control Unit, where it is expelled.  The Cooling Pad looks like any dog bed and is filled with foam for comfort and has a removable cover for easy cleaning.
  3. The Cooling Tube: These small perforated tubes are designed to continuously blow cool air over the Cooling Pad where your pet is laying, helping to control its core body temperature.
  4. The Stay-Cool Water Dish: This incredible device keeps your pet’s water, cool, clean and moving. It continuously circulates up to one gallon of water through a filter and chiller, removing debris, hair and other contaminants (like slobber) and keeping the water cool, refreshing and inviting. It draws power from the Control Unit, so it also continues to function if the power goes out.

The versatility of the Pet Cooling System is what makes it such a great invention. You can use it practically anywhere. Inside the home, out on the deck, in your dog’s kennel or dog house, at the park, at a campsite, in an RV, on a boat, and yes; even in your car. It can be packed up in just a few seconds and taken with you wherever you and your pet go. With the Pet Cooling System, your pet will always have a cool, comfortable place to escape the heat and stay safe from the threat of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.

Based on my research, I believe that the Pet Cooling System, when mass produced, can have a retail cost of $80-$110, making it very affordable for any pet owner.

Thank you for your help in making the Pet Cooling System a reality!
story_txt:
*** UPDATE 29 OCT, 2012:
3/4 of the way through with my campaign and it doesn't look good:( I've done everything I can to promote the Pet Cooling System, but unless there are a lot more contributors, it's not going to become a reality in the next five years. Over 1,000 people have viewed this campaign, and I still have not gotten any feedback as to why people don't want to support this. If YOU decide that you do not want to contribute PLEASE leave me a comment and let me know why.  Thanks.
 
My name is Troy Hawkins, from Boise, Idaho.  I’m asking for your help to make a pet safety invention of mine a reality.  I need to raise $40,000 in order to hire an engineering design firm to construct a prototype and conduct product testing. This is the lowest of four quotes I have recieved. With a working prototype, I will be able to either sell my invention or raise the necessary capital to manufacture them myself.
At this point, I have reached the limits of my financial resources, as well as my engineering skills. I need professionals to complete my work by determining the right materials to use, calculate power usage and heat transfer and refining the manufacturing process. Then it's on to testing to make sure that the Pet Cooling System is durable, long-lasting and maintenance free,
For your $5 contribution, I am going to send you ten e-books. These are great references to use for dog training, understanding behavior and canine nutrition. Use them yourself or give them to someone you know who is getting a dog or puppy for the first time.  Most are easy to read and understandable by children, so they make terrific gifts for new pet parents.

About my invention:

Helps your dog regulate body temperature.
Prevents heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Can be used anywhere there's power, or for up to one hour on the internal battery.
Requires no maintainence from the owner, beyond washing the cover.
Safe, non-toxic materials.
You know that your pet always has a safe, cool spot, even if your A/C breaks or power goes out.

story:
Due to a divorce that took place cross country and took nearly a year and a half to finalize, we have been put into financial crissis. This is being made worse by the fact that now that the divorce is finalized, I have to make a 1,700 mile round trip drive from Iowa to South Dakota on Sept. 21st. and 22nd. This is a trip that can not be avoided. I am driving to the half way point between here and Idaho to exchange vehicles and property with the ex-wife, in accordance to the terms of the divorce. Please help with whatever you can. We wouldn't be asking if it was not vitally important, and needed at this time. 

 

I'm no good at this, and don't know what esle to say. We just need help. Please.

 

Thank you,

 

Patrick and Erin

story:
WHAT IS WESHIPP?


Weshipp is "Uber for collections and shipping", - plain-sailing and really simple! Weshipp will be the defacto standard for you to manage shipment of your parcels, mail and other items, whether you are:

  • An individual sending an item to a loved one/friend
  • An online marketplace trader / store owner fulfilling your orders
  • A small business that wants to use a partner for great value, reliable volume parcel & mail sending

Please check out our website to find out more: http://www.weshipp.com


HOW DOES IT WORK?


Weshipp is very simple. Here’s how the process works:

  • First, download the free, Android or iOS app and create an account
  • Create a new shipment request and enter the destination address and the collection address (we’ll locate where you are with the app)
  • Snap a pic of the item(s) you’re sending, then enter the weight and dimensions
  • Choose your best price and service from our select delivery partners
  • One of our friendly “Shippmates” will come round and collect your item(s) shortly and you’ll see when they’ll arrive in the app
  • Sit back and relax, we’ve got the rest sorted for you. We even do the protection and packaging for you! Shippee! (it’s like Yippee, but… better!)


WHY USE WESHIPP?


Here's why you'll love Weshipp:

  • You'll get cheaper shipping via our partners than going directly or via other parcel brokers
  • You won't wait around for hours for a collection
  • You won't spend any time and money on protecting, packaging and labeling your items
  • We have awesome referral rewards
  • Businesses and high-volume sender will get extra discounts based on commitment
  • You'll get the best customer service
  • The service is fast, fun and friendly
  • Have you got your own boxes/packaging? If so, we'll give you further discounts if you D.I.Y.!


WHAT DOES IT COST?


You’ll pay a low fee of £5.95 for each collection (each collection can have multiple items – depends what can fit in our Shippmates’ rides!) and we will take care of the protection and packaging. We’ll also insure each item while in our transit for £500. What you pay to deliver your items will vary on their size, weight and also which partner and service you wish to use. You'll be able to link your credit card or PayPal account to the app to save time too.


WHAT WILL MY DONATION GO TOWARDS?


Your generous contributions will help us to:

  • Build the iOS and Android mobile apps & the Admin CMS panel
  • Set-up "Shipp" in a warehouse with the relevant inventory to start trading
  • Establish our "cloud" presence and marketing
  • Hire the very first "Shippmates" (they'll be your best mateys!)
  • Kick off the service! You’ll be responsible for changing the way people and businesses ship their items forever! People will say “Shippee!” after using us!


ANYTHING ELSE?


Yes, there are a few things to note:

  • Weshipp will launch in London, United Kingdom initially (in and around the North & South Circular), with plans to quickly expand throughout the whole of London and the country’s biggest cities (Birmingham, Leeds, Liverpool, Manchester, Sheffield, etc) in-demand. We'll eventually have a service nationwide for everyone to benefit from!
  • Weshipp will set up partnerships with businesses to help aid the expansion and make the service even better and cheaper to use for all of our customers.
  • Weshipp will also offer additional services later, like local drop-offs of your items for no extra fee or shipping costs!
  • Weshipp will abide by IATA and road transportation regulations, so this means that we won’t be able to ship some items for you. For a full list, please see this page: http://www.postoffice.co.uk/prohibited-goods-uk
  • Weshipp won’t be able to collect and ship über-heavy/oversized items for you (like a house move, big furniture or items over 25kg), so please bear in mind the space of our vehicles when thinking about what you want to send – we will do our best to accommodate you at all times though!

story:
--Update 2--

THANK YOU for supporting our campaign and reaching the goal! Contact us whenever you like if you want to plan your stay on our islands. Now we are able to finish the bungalow on the second island and it will be available for you in August 2019. But as mentioned many times, you can also stay on our living island, what is an exclusive right and will not be available anymore in that form when the campaign is finished. 

--Update 1--

Many people contact us, because they are interested in their own island in the region. We are happy to give advice. But we cannot consult everybody in detail, mainly because of low internet availability. We must focus, and we focus on people who back our campaign on Indiegogo. So from now on a consultation about obtaining your own island is included in every perk.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Bernd and I live since one year on a lonely island in Indonesia/Sumatra.  The region is called Pulau Banyak, what means "many islands" and that's exactly what it is. There are ~60 lonely islands close to each other, of all kind of shapes and sizes. The islands I rented are in the middle of the region and many other lonely islands are all around. For me it is the most beautiful place on earth and the perfect location for cast away fantasies and eco tourism.

2 islands, same same but different

The island where we live on and where backers can stay, too

The island where me and my friends live on is a non-commercial project. It is like an art project or an adventure playground for adults. We try to live there as self sustained as possible. We build shelters and furniture out of driftwood. We plant vegetables and go fishing for food. We made our dreams become reality. Everybody who supports us can stay on this island and realize his own ideas. Already now guaranteed!

On the other island we build a bungalow for tourists based on a unique cast away concept. We want to create the feeling, that somebody has been stranded on the island for a long time and build his "home" by using available material and resources. To finish this bungalow we need your support!

The design concept for the cast away bungalow

Current state of the cast away bungalow

The design of the bungalow is natural and organic. For supporting elements we use wood, processed appropriately for long-term durability. But we also use a lot of driftwood for decoration, to make the look and feel as authentic as possible. We won't use any plastic or other modern materials like glass, although a modern cast away would probably use a lot of plastic for building his shelter. The design concept is all about the atmosphere. 

We cannot say how exactly the final bungalow will look like because like a cast away we are constantly looking for "loot", which we can use for the bungalow and other parts. The whole design concept is like a cast away story. 

Design details for an even more authentic experience

For us, details are very important! For example the lightning will be natural too with oil lamps, torches, campfire and so on. Together with a strong milky way, glowing algae and storm lightnings at the horizon, it will create a unique night experience you will never forget. Electrical lights are too dominant and swallow all the nature lightning around the island.

The kitchen will be a stone oven and wood is used for heating it up. Learn more about food service in the "service" section".

As much as possible will be improvised on the island as a cast away has no shop to buy anything. Drinking cups for example will be out of bamboo and nautilus shells. Everything should fit to the story. Of course equipment which cannot be improvised like kayaks or snorkeling masks will be normal. Improvising is just a method to make the experience as authentic as possible.

There will be also some other, more hidden details. Guests can find a riddle scratched in a wooden object. If they solve it they can find other riddles which finally lead to a hidden treasure, probably a bottle of rum. In the attic floor of the bungalow, guests can find a hidden room with more mysteries to discover. 

Additional Service by our staff

Our hello kitty boat, used for supporting our guests​

Tourists can live on the island as self sustained as they want. They have everything they need to stay there alone. We provide raw food to them, fresh water, fishing equipment and much more.

But we live on the other island, which is just 500 meters away and we offer all kind of optional services to the guests on the cast away island. Tourists can order food, power banks, transport, tours and other things if they want these kinds of additional services. They can also visit us with their kayaks and eat in our restaurant.

Activities available for tourists & backers

Kayaking is the most fun and most eco friendly way to explore the region

  • Snorkeling: There are many corals and a lot of sea life right next to both islands and all around. Snorkeling equipment is available for guests.
  • Kayaking: Pulau Banyak is probably one of the best places in the world for ocean kayaking. From the cast away island you can reach more than 20 lonely islands with your kayak. We provide a self-made map to our guests where many hotspots like good snorkeling locations are marked. 2 ocean kayaks are available for guests.
  • Island hopping: Either guests use the available kayaks for exploring other islands or they can book a motorboat tour with us to visit some more far away islands.
  • Exploring fascinating sea life: The sea life in Pulau Banyak is very diversified and after one year of living there we still discover something new every other day. For example dolphins are very common in the area. We know how to find them and can bring guests there. Also Dugongs (sea cows) are quite common, but they are very shy. They can be best seen by kayak, you have just to make sure to be at the right spot in the right time. You can even meet whales while snorkeling!
  • Jungle treks: On the bigger islands is a lot of untouched jungle. You can climb up a 400m high jungle mountain, explore caves and waterfalls or visit hidden paradise beaches. We can organize these and other trips for you.
  • Traditional village culture: There are 3 bigger and some smaller local villages on 2 of the biggest islands. The people there are quite isolated and thus the traditional culture is strong. You can experience local food, local dances & celebrations and even traditional shaman medicine.
  • Surfing: Surfing is possible, but the best spots are quite far away from our islands. Beginner surfing is possible close by.
  • Diving: Of course the region is also perfect for diving. However, diving equipment is not available. Feel free to bring your own diving equipment. There are a lot of untouched spots to discover, already 100 m away from our islands!

The building process & its costs

Our local partners are preparing the wood for building

Now we need to finish the bungalow, the kitchen, the toilet and the shower on the cast away island. We build together with locals. Our local partner fully understands the concept and we work perfectly as a team. We also have learned a lot last year while building on the other island.

To finish the basic accommodation we need the following budget:

  • Building material: 1.900 $
  • Salary for local builders: 1.000 $
  • Building tools & transport: 600 $
  • Water tank: 150 $
  • Furniture & equipment: 300 $

If there is additional money from Indiegogo, we will use it for:

  • 2 ocean kayaks: 1.800 $ (the current kayaks are only borrowed)
  • Improving all parts of the accommodation

Timing: We can finish the accommodation in one month if the budget is available but it also depends on the weather. Our plan is to have the island ready for guests until end of July.

Benefits for backing us on Indiegogo

As a backer you have the exclusive right to stay on our islands! Depending on the amount you pledge, you can stay either on the cast away island when the accommodation is finished, including all services available also for paying guests.

But everybody can stay on the support island, where we live on! Sleep in a hammock or in a simple bungalows if free. Use our equipment like snorkeling gear, gas cooker and solar. Go fishing with our spear gun or play with our animals. You can even realize own ideas if they fit to the concept (build something, make some art, improve the garden or whatever you are interested in). Don't think about it too much, just come here and let yourself being inspired by the environment.

Unfortunately, we cannot send you something, you have to come here to collect most of your reward, but the reward is already now guaranteed! The islands exists, the basic infrastructure exists, the experience exists and you could come tomorrow.

Testimonials & Feedback

A simple bungalow on the island where we live, available for backers, too

As a test run we rented the island, where we usually live on, 2 times to tourists via AirBnB and this is their feedback:

"This place is incredible! The perfect place to live out your Robinson Crusoe fantasies. White sand, colourful coral, friendly locals, and you get the whole island to yourself! While it's no 5 star hotel, Bernd has done an amazing job creating a space with everything you could need. I couldn't recommend it more. Just make sure you book for at least a few days as it can be hard to get to and once you're there you might not want to leave."

"Pulau Maila might be one of the prettiest views in the world and probably the coolest cat I have ever met! The view is breath taking and the water is crystal clear! The kayaks are a blast to use to travel to different islands and just look at the different coral around the island."

This island is not designed for tourism, as the cast away island is. The island which you pledge for is much more adjusted to needs of paying tourists. 

We did almost no promotion yet, but already several travel bloggers want to visit us. In June 2019 a book author will visit us, to include our story in his next book about Indonesia, which will be published by DuMont, one of Germany's oldest and largest publishing houses.

Our long term goal: Sustainable eco tourism

Exploring one of the lonely islands. This one has incredible surfing spots all around it.

When the cast away accommodation for tourists is finished, it will secure the basic living expenses for volunteers. Additional income will be used to start more eco tourism projects. We want to introduce sustainable eco tourism to the local people because we strongly believe it will be the only way to keep this beautiful place as much as possible as it is. The locals have already started to sell their islands very cheap to foreign investors, because they don't know what else to do with it. Generic mass tourism will overtake soon if nothing happens.

More and more people are born into our world and natural places like this will disappear. However, the demand for places like this will increase at the same time. Sustainable eco tourism would be a win-win-win situation for nature, locals and tourists alike.

One of our next projects will be an "Escape Island" game on one of the bigger islands. Like an escape room game, but your group is stranded for several days on a lonely island. We want to show that it is not necessary to build bungalows on every island to attract tourists. Lonely islands are the special characteristic of Pulau Banyak and they must stay!

Lets do it together!

I always dreamed about having my own, lonely island in paradise. And somehow I made it happen. Now I want to share this unique experience with the world and especially with you! 

I think many people have dreams about places like this. People who visit me always say that I am living the dream. What about you? Can you relate to my dream? Also tired of our busy society? Then join us!

Or do you have questions? I am happy to answer them. Just drop me a message and I answer as soon as local internet allows me to. Or just come here for a visit ;)

 Hope to see you soon, enjoying the sunset with a fresh coconut on the beach!

Bernd - //Project founder//Island Owner//Adventurer//Cast away//Pirate

We provide raw food to them, fresh water, fishing equipment and much more.But we live on the other island, which is just 500 meters away and we offer all kind of optional services to the guests on the cast away island. Tourists can order food, power banks, transport, tours and other things if they want these kinds of additional services. They can also visit us with their kayaks and eat in our restaurant.Activities available for tourists & backersKayaking is the most fun and most eco friendly way to explore the region

Snorkeling: There are many corals and a lot of sea life right next to both islands and all around. Snorkeling equipment is available for guests.

Kayaking: Pulau Banyak is probably one of the best places in the world for ocean kayaking. From the cast away island you can reach more than 20 lonely islands with your kayak. We provide a self-made map to our guests where many hotspots like good snorkeling locations are marked. 2 ocean kayaks are available for guests.

Island hopping: Either guests use the available kayaks for exploring other islands or they can book a motorboat tour with us to visit some more far away islands.

Exploring fascinating sea life: The sea life in Pulau Banyak is very diversified and after one year of living there we still discover something new every other day. For example dolphins are very common in the area. We know how to find them and can bring guests there. Also Dugongs (sea cows) are quite common, but they are very shy. They can be best seen by kayak, you have just to make sure to be at the right spot in the right time. You can even meet whales while snorkeling!

Jungle treks: On the bigger islands is a lot of untouched jungle. You can climb up a 400m high jungle mountain, explore caves and waterfalls or visit hidden paradise beaches. We can organize these and other trips for you.

Traditional village culture: There are 3 bigger and some smaller local villages on 2 of the biggest islands. The people there are quite isolated and thus the traditional culture is strong. You can experience local food, local dances & celebrations and even traditional shaman medicine.

Surfing: Surfing is possible, but the best spots are quite far away from our islands. Beginner surfing is possible close by.

Diving: Of course the region is also perfect for diving. However, diving equipment is not available. Feel free to bring your own diving equipment. There are a lot of untouched spots to discover, already 100 m away from our islands!
The building process & its costsOur local partners are preparing the wood for buildingNow we need to finish the bungalow, the kitchen, the toilet and the shower on the cast away island. We build together with locals. Our local partner fully understands the concept and we work perfectly as a team. We also have learned a lot last year while building on the other island.To finish the basic accommodation we need the following budget:
Building material: 1.900 $
Salary for local builders: 1.000 $
Building tools & transport: 600 $
Water tank: 150 $
Furniture & equipment: 300 $
If there is additional money from Indiegogo, we will use it for:
2 ocean kayaks: 1.800 $ (the current kayaks are only borrowed)
Improving all parts of the accommodation
Timing: We can finish the accommodation in one month if the budget is available but it also depends on the weather. Our plan is to have the island ready for guests until end of July.Benefits for backing us on IndiegogoAs a backer you have the exclusive right to stay on our islands! Depending on the amount you pledge, you can stay either on the cast away island when the accommodation is finished, including all services available also for paying guests.But everybody can stay on the support island, where we live on! Sleep in a hammock or in a simple bungalows if free. Use our equipment like snorkeling gear, gas cooker and solar. Go fishing with our spear gun or play with our animals. You can even realize own ideas if they fit to the concept (build something, make some art, improve the garden or whatever you are interested in). Don't think about it too much, just come here and let yourself being inspired by the environment.Unfortunately, we cannot send you something, you have to come here to collect most of your reward, but the reward is already now guaranteed! The islands exists, the basic infrastructure exists, the experience exists and you could come tomorrow.Testimonials & FeedbackA simple bungalow on the island where we live, available for backers, tooAs a test run we rented the island, where we usually live on, 2 times to tourists via AirBnB and this is their feedback:"This place is incredible! The perfect place to live out your Robinson Crusoe fantasies. White sand, colourful coral, friendly locals, and you get the whole island to yourself! While it's no 5 star hotel, Bernd has done an amazing job creating a space with everything you could need. I couldn't recommend it more. Just make sure you book for at least a few days as it can be hard to get to and once you're there you might not want to leave.""Pulau Maila might be one of the prettiest views in the world and probably the coolest cat I have ever met! The view is breath taking and the water is crystal clear! The kayaks are a blast to use to travel to different islands and just look at the different coral around the island."This island is not designed for tourism, as the cast away island is. The island which you pledge for is much more adjusted to needs of paying tourists. We did almost no promotion yet, but already several travel bloggers want to visit us. In June 2019 a book author will visit us, to include our story in his next book about Indonesia, which will be published by DuMont, one of Germany's oldest and largest publishing houses.Our long term goal: Sustainable eco tourismExploring one of the lonely islands. This one has incredible surfing spots all around it.When the cast away accommodation for tourists is finished, it will secure the basic living expenses for volunteers. Additional income will be used to start more eco tourism projects. We want to introduce sustainable eco tourism to the local people because we strongly believe it will be the only way to keep this beautiful place as much as possible as it is. The locals have already started to sell their islands very cheap to foreign investors, because they don't know what else to do with it. Generic mass tourism will overtake soon if nothing happens.More and more people are born into our world and natural places like this will disappear. However, the demand for places like this will increase at the same time. Sustainable eco tourism would be a win-win-win situation for nature, locals and tourists alike.One of our next projects will be an "Escape Island" game on one of the bigger islands. Like an escape room game, but your group is stranded for several days on a lonely island. We want to show that it is not necessary to build bungalows on every island to attract tourists. Lonely islands are the special characteristic of Pulau Banyak and they must stay!Lets do it together!I always dreamed about having my own, lonely island in paradise. And somehow I made it happen. Now I want to share this unique experience with the world and especially with you! I think many people have dreams about places like this. People who visit me always say that I am living the dream. What about you? Can you relate to my dream? Also tired of our busy society? Then join us!Or do you have questions? I am happy to answer them. Just drop me a message and I answer as soon as local internet allows me to. Or just come here for a visit ;) Hope to see you soon, enjoying the sunset with a fresh coconut on the beach!Bernd - //Project founder//Island Owner//Adventurer//Cast away//Pirate

story:
We've successfully funded on Kickstarter and are now taking pre-orders on Indiegogo In Demand.

It all started with questions: Why does packing for a day out with the kids take so long? Why is there always so much stuff to carry around? Surely there's an easier way? Well now there is. 

After talking to hundreds of parents and childcare professionals about the challenges of taking children outdoors we designed what we believed could be the world's most functional bag and rug in one, the Brug.

The Brug doubles up as a bag and a rug; it's hard wearing, versatile and water resistant. It’s easy to use and works equally well indoors and outdoors.

Brug v1.0 was launched in 2016, funded by our own savings. We sold out our first production run and had great feedback from our customers but we knew we could make it even better. After 6 months of hard work and a trip to India to meet with our manufacturers, we developed the prototype for Brug v2.0, which we believe to be the perfect and most functional bag and rug in one.

Following our successful 2017 Kickstarter campaign, we've moved to Indiegogo Indemand to maintain the momentum!

We're offering large discounts to backers on Kickstarter in return for supporting us at this early stage of our business. The Brug is available in navy blue with a choice of yellow and orange trim. We will endeavour to deliver your chosen colour, however it's possible that we won't be able to give all backers their first choice. 

Wunderlife was founded by Melissa and Dominique with a vision to develop products that make life a little bit easier for all of us. As parents we know how time pressured family life can be. We're based in Edinburgh, UK and are passionate about what we do. We gave up our jobs to dedicate our time and energy to making Wunderlife and the Brug the greatest success it can be. 

We met in Edinburgh in 2014. We are both busy working mums with a common passion, which is to develop products that make it easier to enjoy the important things in life, like travelling, sport and the outdoors. Not just for families but for anybody with an active lifestyle. 

We saw an opportunity in working together and Wunderlife was born. We then met Felix, who takes pride in designing quality products that people love, particularly textiles products. He also enjoys travelling and the outdoors so between us we saw a good opportunity to create and deliver something really special.

We are excited by products that are versatile, hard wearing and work in all sorts of environments. Our dream was to develop a product that makes packing for a day out really easy, cuts down on the number of things to take and stores easily when not being used. Something that could be used for any outdoor activity but would work equally well in the home, to tidy up after children and protect surfaces from the inevitable messy spills. In short, we imagined the perfect solution to many of our headaches. And so, the Brug was born!

 

 

 

Our customers loved Brug V1.0 but we knew we could make it even better with the addition of some carefully considered features. We believe these key changes make the Brug the most perfectly functional bag and rug in one.

The Brug is all about functionality, versatility and ease of use. Our starting point was to design a product that makes life with kids easier. However, we also researched it amongst many people who don't have kids but lead active lives, with pets, travelling and sport, to understand how the Brug could address as many needs as possible. 

Following our research, we moved quickly from sketches to prototyping, trialling and testing to refine the design and develop a production ready sample of Brug v2.0 to launch into the market.

Our manufacturing partner has been with us from the beginning and we’re delighted with the quality of workmanship and their ethical business practice. 

We will be as proactive as possible to ensure that we distribute the goods as quickly as we can. Production will commence as soon as the Kickstarter campaign is finished at the end of March. Our aim is to deliver the Brugs to you by end of June. 

Shipping rates will be added by Kickstarter when making the pledge. If your country isn't listed please contact us for a shipping quote.

Thank you very much for supporting us. We want as many people to know about our project as possible so we would be really grateful if you were to share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter. We really appreciate your support.

Please click here to access our press pack. Please contact us if you can't find what you would like!

Thanks to Wildness Films for our video and stills. Thanks also to Felix Kenchington for the product design and helping run our campaign.

story:
Hello to everyone!!
Me  and my best friend from Greece we have set a goal of snowbording the Todorka peak of bansko mountain. We are both attend to the Democritus university of Thrace at the department of environmental engineering. We both like extreme sports and snowboarding is one of these. The last years we have visit Bansko ski zone to snowboard and this year's goal except from fun is to achieve a free-ride from the peak of the mountain at 2742 meters. To achieve this goal we should have raise the above amount of money in order to fulfill the requirements of that goal. First of all due to the economic crisis in Greece it is extremely difficult for us to do those expenses for the trip and also sustain our studies. The biggest cost of that attempt is calculated by the transaction and accommodation. We have to travel 500 kilometers (100euros) and we need to stay for 3 or 4 days(200-250euros) in order to meet the best condition for the free-ride. We also need some funds in order to enhance our equipment and be able to meet the rough condition of a such a dangerous environment. The rest of the money will  be spent on filming this attempt and to the ski passes for the days in Bansko.
Thank you very much for the understanding the importance of this trip for us and you are welcome to contribute to our project. Even if you can't fund our project it would be really helpful to share the campaign to others..
Thank you in advance ..

P.S. We hope we can provide you with really nice footage of our attempt..!

story:
As some of you might know, Dave & Amie were originally planning on driving up the California coast for their honeymoon. Due to some of the wedding expenses, they cancelled their honeymoon. 
We are asking for donations to make sure these lovebirds get the honeymoon the deserve. 
We are not asking for any specific amount, anything will be greatly appreciated. 
One more thing, let's keep this a secret between you and me and surprise them with the funds. I bet we can make Amie cry. :)
Thanks! Much Love!

Due to some of the wedding expenses, they cancelled their honeymoon. We are asking for donations to make sure these lovebirds get the honeymoon the deserve. We are not asking for any specific amount, anything will be greatly appreciated. One more thing, let's keep this a secret between you and me and surprise them with the funds. I bet we can make Amie cry. :)Thanks! Much Love!

story:
Takoma’s Heartbeat: Fund the Summer Drum Circles at the Gazebo!

In the summertime, the heartbeat of Takoma Park is alive and well at the Gazebo drum circles. From May to September, the community gathers once a month to drum, dance, sing and play together. The drum circles give people a place to let go of stress, connect with one another and make music.  The joy and the energy that is created is tangible and transformative! 

       

These drum circles are led by drum circle facilitator Katy Gaughan, which means she:

·     provides drums and instruments for the community

·     offers instruction on how to play the drum

·     “conducts” the drumming to create beautiful music through rhythm and songs

·     helps participants connect to each other and build community

·     organizes the crew to offer solid support on the bass drums

To make sure these drum circles keep going this summer, we need your help to raise money to fund the drum circles!!

For every $400 raised, Katy and her crew will offer a monthly drum circle.  

Let’s pitch in and meal the goal of $2000 so we can meet once a month in May, June, July, August & September. If we raise more than $2000 …. More drum circles! 

Katy believes in the healing power of music and offers this service as a contribution to the community.  In order for the drum circles to keep going though, there are costs that must be covered.

$400/circle pays for:

·  Organization and promotional expenses 

·  Drums and instruments 

·  Professional facilitation by Katy Gaughan 

·  Crew & logistical support 

Think about it this way: how much do you pay for a yoga class?  Or a concert?  Those investments are worth your time and money, right?  Well, so is a community drum circle!  And your support pays it forward because these circles benefit the entire community!

So far, House of Musical Traditions and Main Street Takoma have pledged $200 each, totaling $400.  The Olive Lounge will host a fundraiser the evening of April 10 and give 15% of their proceeds to the Summer Drum Circles.  That means we're almost half of our way already!  

Please pitch in whatever you can to keep the heartbeat alive and well in Takoma Park! Whether it’s $1, $5, $25 or $100, your support will make a difference!!! 

THANK YOU!  LET'S DRUM!!

story:
Trip Trap is the Live Escape Game we created. Being fan of adventure movies, we have always wanted to be part of one. It seems like the best way to reach that goal was to create a game in which the player IS the hero.

We discovered Live Escape Games last year and since then we have been working to create one in our home town : Geneva.


At the beginning we thought it would be a walk in the park but rapidly realized that creating a company was not that easy. Most of our time went into creating the puzzles. As perfection was our goal, it took us months to deliver the puzzle we were really proud of.


And we did by launching our first Live Escape Game as a pop-up event last May - The Treasure of Jack Rackham ! A pirate’s adventure in which you are Rackham’s chief mate and have 60 minutes to find the key to his treasure chest. 

As we didn’t have a location to set it up, we ended up building one: The Box.

 The stage was set for welcoming players. In 2 weeks, we had over 70 groups and more than 350 people who came looking for that key. 

Happy Trip Trappers who just made it out


After this successful start we are more motivated than ever to build a permanent structure. We found the perfect location in the city center and set the date for a grand opening : September 1st!

This is where we need you. 

Having invested our life saving money in this project, we are almost there but still lack a little more to complete the devices that will blow your mind away. So if like us you have always dreamed of being part of a great adventure, this is your chance. Please be part of the Trip Trap adventure, give us hand and offer Geneva an awesome new activity.


www.triptrapescape.ch

story:
My story:

My name is Jeff Smith, I am 53 years old, I have 2 false hips and I want to climb Mount Everest and inspire our future generation. I started climbing in 2010 and over the years have climbed many mountains raising money for charity (in total I have raised almost £100,000).

In 2014 I set off on a self funded trip to attempt to climb Mount Everest but after a huge avalanche on the mountain killed sixteen sherpa, the mountain was closed, our expedition was cancelled and I had to return home without achieving my dream. 

Now in 2017 I am ready for this challenge again. Instead of fundraising this year I have decided that I want to use this journey as a force for good and talk to school children everywhere about 'achieving their potential'. This time around I need to get sponsorship to pay for the trip however, after two main sponsors pulled out just 3 months before my date to leave I have been unsure if this trip was going to go ahead however, I then realised I need to practice what I'm preaching and 'never give up.'

I have spoken to over one-thousand school children already, with many more schools in the diary to visit and I want to give this trip my best shot and prove to these children that if you really want something, work hard, prepare and never ever give up you will get there.

This is a huge challenge not only with the physical training but also now with the fight to get the money. With your help and donation I will be one step closer to, achieving my potential and highlighting to children everywhere that they too can achieve theirs with hard work and dedication. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

For this trip to go ahead I need £25,000, this is to pay for flights, visas and all the ropes and guides needed to ensure a safe trip. 

I am asking for anybody out there who may want to help me with the challenge of raising this money to please 'sponsor a mile' of my journey to everest, I am charging £5 a mile with 5155 miles to sell, all money will go directly to the everest journey and will contribute to growing and inspiring the minds of school children across the uk.

I have put together lots of perks, with things being brought home from Nepal, postcards being sent and photos being taken and signed from different sections of the mountain.

I would absolutely love to have you on board for this trip and I hope you see the power of inspiring children to follow their dreams as important as I do. 

Please share this journey with your friends and lets teach the future generation that:

"If you can dream it, you can do it" - Walt Disney

I would absolutely love to have you on board for this trip and I hope you see the power of inspiring children to follow their dreams as important as I do. 
Please share this journey with your friends and lets teach the future generation that:
"If you can dream it, you can do it" - Walt Disney

story:
Hi! We're two people who share a passion for all things bicycle.

We've been living in Bicycle City, USA, for 25 collective years (Shawn 10 and April 15).  In that time we've soaked up a lot of what makes Portland a unique place.  We've also logged in thousands of miles of traveling by bike around the Northwest.  Now we want to go to the next level.


We're currently exploring United States and Canada by the saddles of our bicycles.  An adventure like this is ambitious enough in its own right.  But we don't want to just ride thousands of miles, see some sights, and take some photos.  We want to see what's going on in other cities and towns in regards to bicycling.  A lot has happened over the last decade or so. Scenes have popped up in towns small and large.  Bike lanes are being striped.  The number of cyclists is going up and up. 


There are a lot of factors going into this Bicycle Renaissance but we want to concentrate on the human factor--the people who are making a difference in their own way. We want to see what kinds of cool stuff other cities are doing, like fun rides or other events. We want to seek out and talk to those people.  The blogger. The zine writer. The person who started up a weekly or monthly ride.  The folks who run the community bicycle shop. The advocates and activists.  The bicycle artists and crafters.  And the people who just love bicycles. 


We hit the road on May 27 and don't plan to be home until November. In this five month span we'll be riding, we'll slowly head eastward from Portland with the ultimate goal of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Over the thousand miles we've ridden during our first month on the road, we've passed through Vancouver, North Cascades National Park, northern Washington, Spokane, the Idaho Panhandle, Missoula, Montana, and Glacier National Park. And we plan on hitting up parks like Waterton Lakes, Banff, and Jasper, and cities as diverse as Calgary, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Regina, Winnipeg, Fargo, Duluth, Minneapolis, Iowa City, Chicago, Fort Wayne, Columbus, Pittsburgh, Washington DC, Baltimore, Philadelphia, New York, New Haven, Boston, Burlington, Montreal, and Quebec City.


We'll be writing about our adventures through our respective blogs,http://urbanadventureleague.blogspot.com/ (Shawn) and http://aprillikesbikes.wordpress.com/(April).  


But ultimately we want to collect our adventures into a book!  A book, you say?  Rest assured, we're not novices to publishing.  Shawn has been involved in mini-comics and zines for 15 years, self publishing the comic Ten Foot Rule and editing the Zinester's Guide To Portland, published by Microcosm Publishing.


The Impact

A lot has been made about the Bicycle Renaissance, but much of it has focused on "numbers"--amount of people bicycle commuting, number and length of bike lanes, etc.  We want to bring attention to the less tangible aspects.  We also want to shine a light on the people making it happen in less conspicuous ways.  One does not have to be a policy wonk to make a difference.


By sharing our experiences through the web and a book we hope to inspire others to "do something".  We want to show folks that they aren't alone out there.  We want to show folks that bicycle touring is a fun thing to do, and while our tour is definitely on the "ambitious" side, anyone can do a tour if they have the right mindset. We also want to show people that they can start bike fun in their own towns.

What We Need & What You Get

We're frugal folks and have experience living on little.  We're going to do this trip no matter what, but any and all donations will help us on the road.  We're looking at being on the road for up to five months so money is definitely important.  The money we'll get will be used towards the expenses on the road--food, lodging, transit beyond bicycles when needed, and bicycle repairs and maintenance.  What we have left over if any will help us with the publishing aspect of this project.


Other Ways You Can Help


  • Host us along our route!  We'll be staying at a mix of campgrounds, hostels, friend's homes, and Warmshowers hosts along the way, but we can always use a hand here.  Lodging is the biggest expense of a tour besides food.  Giving us a spot to sleep for a night or two will help alleviate this, plus we love staying with interesting folks whenever we can. You can check out the rough route of the tour on my blog to see where we're going.
  • Give us info!  We want to check out as many cool things as possible along the way, whether it be natural splendour, cool bike shops, interesting bicycle events, people doing good things involving bicycles, you know what we mean. I've been doing as much research as possible, but can always use more advice.
  • Ride with us!  If you feel like spending a day or two or even more bicycle touring with us, please let us know.
  • Spread the word!

You can check out the rough route of the tour on my blog to see where we're going.

Give us info!  We want to check out as many cool things as possible along the way, whether it be natural splendour, cool bike shops, interesting bicycle events, people doing good things involving bicycles, you know what we mean. I've been doing as much research as possible, but can always use more advice.

Ride with us!  If you feel like spending a day or two or even more bicycle touring with us, please let us know.
Spread the word!

story:
I leave for the Balkans on the 27th September, flying into Belgrade and flying out of Skopje. I will cycle solo through Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Albania and Macedonia, covering around 1000Km whilst battling the elements, mountains, wild camping and a temperamental bicycle. 

I'm doing the challenge for fun and also to raise money for a charity which has helped me move forward with my life. Heal For Life is a charity for survivors of childhood trauma and abuse. They offer a five day residential therapy program aimed at healing the traumatised child within and helping people take steps to start living a more fulfilled existence. 

I took part in their first UK program in May this year and found it a revelation. It really helped me work through difficult issues that I'd been holding onto and it's no exaggeration to say it was life changing. My childhood was difficult. I spent time in foster care as my mother battled with debilitating mental health problems. Eventually she took her own life and I had to come to terms with my grief. As a young man I held onto my pain, which eventually took hold and pushed me into the dark pit of depression. I found therapy extremely difficult; it helped but I never really trusted the process. The Heal for Life program was different. All the carers were survivors themselves and you have a full five days away from the world to work on your issues. The setting really allowed for drastic work to be done. The techniques are backed up by scientific research, tangible and effective. 

I'm aiming to raise £2000 which will go into the sponsorship fund that supports people who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves. Heal For Life is a not-for-profit organisation and the course costs £400 per person, so if I reach my goal we will be supporting five people on their healing journey. As they say every penny counts and I really appreciate every donation no matter how small or large. 

You can check out the Heal For Life webpages for more information.

http://healforlife.com.au/

http://www.healforlife.org.uk/

Thanks!
