story:
Introducing the Bwindi Field Tent. Purposely designed for international travelers, aid workers, and field researchers, this tent is designed to help you sleep safer and better throughout your journeys.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

From urban hotels, to rural guesthouses, to remote field locations, the self-standing mosquito net converts to a robust outdoor 3-season outdoor tent providing a protective and strong physical barrier between you and any disease-carrying insects in the air, ground or mattress you are sleeping on.

 

 

Packs small

 

Being small means the Bwindi Field tent is easy to take with you wherever your travels take you. Don't fuss with mosquito nets that need to be hung or oversized mosquito pop-up tents that need to be checked in as their own piece of luggage.

 

Modular - take only what you need

 

 

Only the poles and the tent are required for the indoor mosquito tent. To get full 3-season protection outdoors, bring along the fly-sheet,  ground-sheet, and stakes which are all included with your Bwindi Field Tent.


 

Access zippers to 2 pockets in all 4 corners

 

 

All 4 corners of the Bwindi Field Tent have access zippers that access 2 pockets each.

 

 

You can charge anything you need from any of the 4 corners and feel confident in knowing that the pocket itself acts as a back-up layer of mesh protection to the zipper opening.

 

18 inside pockets

22 inside attachment loops

1 roof shelf

 

 

You didn't read that wrong - make yourself at home, and you can stop sleeping on your stuff!

The Bwindi Field Tent has 9 pockets on each end of the tent (=18 total)  that also create a double-wall of mesh around the lower part of each end of the tent. Our stronger materials mean the pockets can actually hold things (watch, eyeglasses, notebooks, phone, radio, lights, etc.) without the tent walls sagging down on you.

The roof shelf hangs in the middle of the roof but you can use any of the loops to connect it at whichever angle you prefer wherever you prefer.

 

 

There are 22 internal loops for hanging gear, installing internal guy lines for increased stability, and for attaching a sleeping sheet across the floor.

 

Precision design and construction

 

 

 

 

 

Available in 4 colors

 

Our color lineup is inspired by feedback from specific users. Whether you want to be discreet or be highly visible, we provide a color palette that offers functional options for what you need.

 

Fits in your favorite carry-on

 

Our custom length poles are custom sized to be under 40 cm to easily fit into most multi-day carry-on bags and suitcases.

 

 

Thoughtfully designed quality packing bags for each of the tent components allow you to take what you need and leave what you don't.

 

 

The stuff sacks/bags are slightly larger than needed so it's super easy to stuff your tent, fly, and groundsheet into them and then form the stuff sacks into whatever shape fits your bag best.

 

 

 

 

Field.Work is bringing back the tradition of the field tent. We wanted to make a tent that met the following criteria:

  • designed for international travel
  • made to be lived in for multiple weeks at a time
  • made of proven materials and simple components that could be repaired in the field with needle and thread and/or duct tape

 

 
 
 

Tent - features summary

 

Flysheet - features summary

 

Technical specifications

 

 

Materials

 

 

 

Instructional videos

 

 

 

 

The Bwindi Field Tent is 100% insecticide free and relies on its high-quality materials and design to keep you safer at night by providing a 360-degree physical barrier around you while you sleep.

 

 

While will we can not guarantee that insects won't get in your tent if the doors or zippers are left open or if they hitch a ride on you, as you enter the tent, our field tests show that once you are inside and all zipped-up that you'll be protected from any insects outside. To be 100% sure that that you won't be bitten do not sleep against the mesh walls of the tent - we have the sized the Bwindi Field tent slightly wider than the average 1-person tent to better accommodate this.

Apply a permethrin treatment if you wish

It is your call if you want to use a permethrin mosquito spray on your Bwindi Field Tent. Permethrin is an insecticide that kills mosquitoes and other small insects on contact. It is readily available in stores (and online) and permethrin-treated mosquito nets are currently recommended by the World Health Organization for protection against mosquitoes. We would caution that recent studies are indicating the potential for a linkage between permethrin and effects on human health. This is the reason why we left the choice up to you as to what you are comfortable with by keeping the Bwindi Field Tent 100% insecticide free.

If you choose to use permethrin, consumer available permethrin sprays should not hurt your Bwindi Field Tent as long as you follow the application instructions they provide. Treat the Bwindi Field Tent with the spray as it advises to treat any other piece of material or clothing.

DEET based mosquito repellant can have a chemical reaction with both the waterproof coating and/or the polyester material that the Bwindi Field Tent is made of so we DO NOT recommend getting any DEET based product on your tent. 

 

 

 

 

THE SUPER PERK:
The Bwindi Expedition

 

 

OUR SUPER PERK IS A ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY!

Field.Work is super excited to partner with the amazing and experienced adventure travel company Rock My Adventure to offer a once in a lifetime trip to Bwindi and beyond. 

This expedition aims to explore my favorite city in Africa before heading west to Lake Kivu where we will prepare to trek to the top of  Mount Nyiragongo within Virunga National Park and sleep on the crater rim. Then we will head into the rain forests of Bwindi Impenetrable Forest in search of the critically endangered mountain gorillas. We'll be guided by the park's dedicated rangers who protect the mountain gorillas and leaving a number of Bwindi Field Tents as a donation to support their efforts. After Bwindi, we head into the misty Rwenzori mountains (from the Ugandan side), also known as the 'mountains of the moon' and one of the sources of the Nile river where we'll do a three-day trek before decompressing at Lake Bunyoni.

The expedition will have optional mini-training events throughout on topics such as travel safety, security, and photography. 

THE PLAN

  • Day 1: Arrival in Kigali, Rwanda
  • Day 2: Tour Kigali
  • Day 3: Travel to Lake Kivu, overnight at a lakeside lodge
  • Day 4: Trek to the top of Lake Nyiragongo, DRC -  overnight at huts at the top
  • Day 5: Descent back down to Lake Kivu - relax and overnight there
  • Day 6: Travel to Bwindi, Uganda - overnight at Bwindi National Park
  • Day 7: Go Gorilla trekking - overnight at Bwindi National Park
  • Day 8: Travel to the Rwenzori's - overnight at a lodge in the Rwenzori
  • Day 9, 10, 11: Three-day trek in the Rwenzori - camping
  • Day 11: Travel to Lake Bunyoni -  overnight at a lakeside lodge
  • Day 12: A boat tour of Lake Bunyoni,  travel back to Kigali - End of tour/departure.

COST

The cost will be $3995 USD per person including hotels,  lodges,  camping,  meals,  transfers, guides, permits and scheduled activities. Not included costs are international flights into/out of Kigali, visas, medications, travel insurance, etc. 

HOW TO JOIN THE BWINDI EXPEDITION

  1. Contact us: contact@field.work  -  We'll give you all the information you need to make an informed decision.
  2. Pay your deposit using the Super Perk!
  3. Join our private expedition WhatsApp group and start preparing!
  4. Get your Bwindi Field Tent!
  5. Don't forget it on your way to Kigali!

IMPORTANT NOTES

Please note that this itinerary acts as a framework plan. This is an expedition, and the leadership team may need to be adaptive to frictions encountered en route. Should events in the region dictate that this itinerary is no longer possible at any point prior to departure or during the expedition and alternative, modifications will be made to ensure the safest options will be substituted. 

This expedition is designed to be achievable by people with an active and healthy lifestyle and no previous experience is necessary to join. However, it is arduous at points and will test you. You will be sore, tired, wet, and possibly hungry. It is your responsibility to prepare physically and mentally for the expedition and be ready for living in basic conditions. 

Please don't hesitate to contact us - and we recommend that you do - if you have any questions at contact@field.work 

More information is available online and a pre-expedition guidebook will soon be available.  An application form is necessary to complete prior to confirmation of your participation (if for any reason you do not meet the physical/health/other requirements for the trip, you will be refunded all but the price of your Bwindi Field Tent).  A health, safety, and security waiver will also be required to be signed prior to participating in the expedition.

 

 

It's our first time crowdfunding a product, which means it's also our first time here on Indiegogo! If it's your first time backing a crowdfunding campaign we've put this together to help put all the information you need in one place regarding the get-your-perk-process:

 

New to Indiegogo?

Here is how it works:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

It really has been an amazing 2-year journey to finally reach this point and I’m so thankful for everyone that I’ve met (mentioned and not) and who has supported, encouraged, and kicked me in the ass along the way whenever things felt uphill.

 

 

Looking forward...

I don’t want to make just one tent.

Correction. The team that has come together to make both The Bwindi Field Tent and Field.Work what it is today, does not want to make just one tent. We want to build a sustainable business that truly cares about helping those of us working far from home and often off-the-grid have a safer time doing it. Could that mean future tents? Future gear? We won’t know until the end of this campaign but we’d be stoked if you join us!

This is how you can support us

  • Support this campaign by becoming a backer and buy a perk to get your own Bwindi Field Tent!
  • Tell everyone you know that might be interested in getting their own Bwindi Field Tent using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Keep us up to date on your tent - send us feedback, photos, videos, anything that helps us understand your experience with the Bwindi Field Tent and how we can make it better
  • Have ideas? Share them with us.  If this campaign is successful, we’ve got ideas for our next product(s) but we would love to hear yours if you’d like to share it!

 

 

The team at that put this campaign together is a small remote group of dedicated, hard-working, professionals. For Jordon and Hoa, the Bwindi Field Tent and Field.Work is a serious side business that we hope evolves into a sustainable business. Jordon works in the field - mostly in Africa but also South America and South-East Asia. Hoa is an avid outdoors and yoga practitioner with her most recent expedition being to the borderlands of Kyrgyzstan and Afghanistan.

Field.Work is a business unit of Independent Social Performance Pte. Ltd.

  • Jordon Kuschminder, Creator of the Bwindi Field Tent & Director of Field.Work -  lives in The Netherlands // Jordon is the Executive Director of Singapore-incorporated Independent Social Performance Pte Ltd - a consulting firm that works on the community aspects of oil, gas, and mining in complex social environments. Before starting Independent SP, he was Senior Manager Exploration Community Relations for Barrick Gold and Community Development Manager for Shell International Exploration and Production.
  • Hoa Ta, Director of Vietnam Operations for FIELD.WORK -  live in Vietnam // Hoa is the Manager, Mergers and Acquisitions in Transactions Advisory Services at EY Vietnam. Previously she was a Senior Executive in the Project Management Office at Export-Import Bank Vietnam.

The dynamic YouTube duo of Nellie Winter and Greg Snell came on board after a coffee meeting in St. Julians, Malta that progressed to dinner in Portimão, Portugal where most of the video footage and photographs used in the campaign were taken. They constantly travel the world but you'd never know it by how fantastic and easy they are to work with. 

  • Nellie Winter, Social Media Coordinator, Winter's Marketing - digial nomad
  • Greg Snell, Videographer, Snell Media - digital nomad

 

 

 

 

Marketing

 

 


 

A note on large orders

We are fully set-up to accommodate large orders for your company or organization. To get your hands on 5 or more Bwindi Field Tents. Contact us (email: contact@field.work)  to set you up with an Indiegogo 'Secret Perk' at a special price.

 

Shipping

We will ship your Bwindi Field tent to anywhere in the world but shipping is not included in the Indiegogo perk prices. 

Shipping is $39 dollars worldwide.

 

Customs and duties

Our prices on Indiegogo DO NOT include VAT, GST, or other country taxes.

Indeigogo campaigns regularly fulfill orders worldwide without any issues, and we expect this to be the case with ours too. In saying that, don't claim to have extensive experience or knowledge of how customs works in countries all over the world. We can't guarantee that you won't experience delay's or be charged import duties. 

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all freight and duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is not possible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Indiegogo or help you determine that for your shipment. If you wish to learn about the duties and taxes applicable to your shipment, you may want to check with the customs and border protection authority of your country.

We found this helpful tool, that might be able to assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the USD to your local currency when you use it: www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator/

 

Product warranty

We believe in our product and stand by the quality of workmanship and materials. Reach out with whatever concern you might have and we will make it right.

Most of you know this but crowdfunding is an amazing tool that allows people to get their ideas off the ground. Indiegogo is not a store and "perks" are the way that we say thank you for supporting us  - we are VERY grateful. 

 

Return policy

Field.Work does not offer refunds or returns on tents/products that were received as an Indiegogo Perk. But having said this, we're people too. Let us know your concern and we will see what we can do for your specific situation.

The Bwindi Super Expedition deposit is also non-refundable but it is transferable to someone else that qualifies by meeting the same application process as all participants - a questionnaire and a call with Helen and I.

 

Risks and challenges

MANUFACTURING. It's worth mentioning that the Bwindi Field Tent already exists. In preparation for this Indiegogo campaign, we conducted a 'short' production run of 50 tents. These tents came out perfect and we learned more about our production timeline. Our factory partner has been fantastic from day 1. They are incredibly qualified, skilled and reliable. We are also personally involved. Hoa lives a 25 min drive to the factory and she maintains regular contact with the factory team at all times. Jordon will be in Vietnam to be part of overseeing the QA/QC of the final tents coming off the production line just because he's that kind of a guy :) 

ORDER FULFILLMENT. There are two issues to this. Having the product ready to ship and the complexity of shipping a (hopefully?) large number of orders internationally. We admit it's our first campaign so we've partnered up with BackerKit to support us with fulfillment. Our previously mentioned short production run has helped us to understand potential issues (i.e. it's ordering the custom poles that have the biggest time impact on our schedule) and so we've set thoughtful timelines that we're confident - in consultation with the factory - we can stick to.

TRANSPARENCY. In life and in business there are always unforeseeable risks and challenges and we are committed to putting forth every effort to do right by you the backer, if or when any such situation arises. There will no doubt be some twists and turns in the path ahead but if it is going to impact you the backer, the product or your delivery date, we commit to proactively informing you as soon as we understand the situation.  This will be done by updates here on Indiegogo or, if necessary by email as the situation calls for.

 

Thank you for your support of the

Bwindi Field Tent!
story_txt:
Introducing the Bwindi Field Tent. Purposely designed for international travelers, aid workers, and field researchers, this tent is designed to help you sleep safer and better throughout your journeys.        From urban hotels, to rural guesthouses, to remote field locations, the self-standing mosquito net converts to a robust outdoor 3-season outdoor tent providing a protective and strong physical barrier between you and any disease-carrying insects in the air, ground or mattress you are sleeping on. 

 
Packs small Being small means the Bwindi Field tent is easy to take with you wherever your travels take you. Don't fuss with mosquito nets that need to be hung or oversized mosquito pop-up tents that need to be checked in as their own piece of luggage. Modular - take only what you need  Only the poles and the tent are required for the indoor mosquito tent. To get full 3-season protection outdoors, bring along the fly-sheet,  ground-sheet, and stakes which are all included with your Bwindi Field Tent. Access zippers to 2 pockets in all 4 corners  All 4 corners of the Bwindi Field Tent have access zippers that access 2 pockets each.  You can charge anything you need from any of the 4 corners and feel confident in knowing that the pocket itself acts as a back-up layer of mesh protection to the zipper opening. 18 inside pockets22 inside attachment loops1 roof shelf  You didn't read that wrong - make yourself at home, and you can stop sleeping on your stuff!The Bwindi Field Tent has 9 pockets on each end of the tent (=18 total)  that also create a double-wall of mesh around the lower part of each end of the tent. Our stronger materials mean the pockets can actually hold things (watch, eyeglasses, notebooks, phone, radio, lights, etc.) without the tent walls sagging down on you.The roof shelf hangs in the middle of the roof but you can use any of the loops to connect it at whichever angle you prefer wherever you prefer.  There are 22 internal loops for hanging gear, installing internal guy lines for increased stability, and for attaching a sleeping sheet across the floor. Precision design and construction     Available in 4 colors Our color lineup is inspired by feedback from specific users. Whether you want to be discreet or be highly visible, we provide a color palette that offers functional options for what you need. Fits in your favorite carry-on Our custom length poles are custom sized to be under 40 cm to easily fit into most multi-day carry-on bags and suitcases.  Thoughtfully designed quality packing bags for each of the tent components allow you to take what you need and leave what you don't.  The stuff sacks/bags are slightly larger than needed so it's super easy to stuff your tent, fly, and groundsheet into them and then form the stuff sacks into whatever shape fits your bag best.    Field.Work is bringing back the tradition of the field tent. We wanted to make a tent that met the following criteria:
designed for international travel
made to be lived in for multiple weeks at a time
made of proven materials and simple components that could be repaired in the field with needle and thread and/or duct tape
    Tent - features summary Flysheet - features summary Technical specifications  Materials   Instructional videos    The Bwindi Field Tent is 100% insecticide free and relies on its high-quality materials and design to keep you safer at night by providing a 360-degree physical barrier around you while you sleep.  While will we can not guarantee that insects won't get in your tent if the doors or zippers are left open or if they hitch a ride on you, as you enter the tent, our field tests show that once you are inside and all zipped-up that you'll be protected from any insects outside. To be 100% sure that that you won't be bitten do not sleep against the mesh walls of the tent - we have the sized the Bwindi Field tent slightly wider than the average 1-person tent to better accommodate this.Apply a permethrin treatment if you wishIt is your call if you want to use a permethrin mosquito spray on your Bwindi Field Tent. Permethrin is an insecticide that kills mosquitoes and other small insects on contact. It is readily available in stores (and online) and permethrin-treated mosquito nets are currently recommended by the World Health Organization for protection against mosquitoes. We would caution that recent studies are indicating the potential for a linkage between permethrin and effects on human health. This is the reason why we left the choice up to you as to what you are comfortable with by keeping the Bwindi Field Tent 100% insecticide free.If you choose to use permethrin, consumer available permethrin sprays should not hurt your Bwindi Field Tent as long as you follow the application instructions they provide. Treat the Bwindi Field Tent with the spray as it advises to treat any other piece of material or clothing.DEET based mosquito repellant can have a chemical reaction with both the waterproof coating and/or the polyester material that the Bwindi Field Tent is made of so we DO NOT recommend getting any DEET based product on your tent.     THE SUPER PERK:The Bwindi Expedition  OUR SUPER PERK IS A ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY!Field.Work is super excited to partner with the amazing and experienced adventure travel company Rock My Adventure to offer a once in a lifetime trip to Bwindi and beyond. This expedition aims to explore my favorite city in Africa before heading west to Lake Kivu where we will prepare to trek to the top of  Mount Nyiragongo within Virunga National Park and sleep on the crater rim. Then we will head into the rain forests of Bwindi Impenetrable Forest in search of the critically endangered mountain gorillas. We'll be guided by the park's dedicated rangers who protect the mountain gorillas and leaving a number of Bwindi Field Tents as a donation to support their efforts. After Bwindi, we head into the misty Rwenzori mountains (from the Ugandan side), also known as the 'mountains of the moon' and one of the sources of the Nile river where we'll do a three-day trek before decompressing at Lake Bunyoni.The expedition will have optional mini-training events throughout on topics such as travel safety, security, and photography. THE PLAN
Day 1: Arrival in Kigali, Rwanda
Day 2: Tour Kigali
Day 3: Travel to Lake Kivu, overnight at a lakeside lodge
Day 4: Trek to the top of Lake Nyiragongo, DRC -  overnight at huts at the top
Day 5: Descent back down to Lake Kivu - relax and overnight there
Day 6: Travel to Bwindi, Uganda - overnight at Bwindi National Park
Day 7: Go Gorilla trekking - overnight at Bwindi National Park
Day 8: Travel to the Rwenzori's - overnight at a lodge in the Rwenzori
Day 9, 10, 11: Three-day trek in the Rwenzori - camping
Day 11: Travel to Lake Bunyoni -  overnight at a lakeside lodge
Day 12: A boat tour of Lake Bunyoni,  travel back to Kigali - End of tour/departure.
COSTThe cost will be $3995 USD per person including hotels,  lodges,  camping,  meals,  transfers, guides, permits and scheduled activities. Not included costs are international flights into/out of Kigali, visas, medications, travel insurance, etc. HOW TO JOIN THE BWINDI EXPEDITION
Contact us: contact@field.work  -  We'll give you all the information you need to make an informed decision.
Pay your deposit using the Super Perk!
Join our private expedition WhatsApp group and start preparing!
Get your Bwindi Field Tent!
Don't forget it on your way to Kigali!
IMPORTANT NOTESPlease note that this itinerary acts as a framework plan. This is an expedition, and the leadership team may need to be adaptive to frictions encountered en route. Should events in the region dictate that this itinerary is no longer possible at any point prior to departure or during the expedition and alternative, modifications will be made to ensure the safest options will be substituted. This expedition is designed to be achievable by people with an active and healthy lifestyle and no previous experience is necessary to join. However, it is arduous at points and will test you. You will be sore, tired, wet, and possibly hungry. It is your responsibility to prepare physically and mentally for the expedition and be ready for living in basic conditions. Please don't hesitate to contact us - and we recommend that you do - if you have any questions at contact@field.work More information is available online and a pre-expedition guidebook will soon be available.  An application form is necessary to complete prior to confirmation of your participation (if for any reason you do not meet the physical/health/other requirements for the trip, you will be refunded all but the price of your Bwindi Field Tent).  A health, safety, and security waiver will also be required to be signed prior to participating in the expedition.  It's our first time crowdfunding a product, which means it's also our first time here on Indiegogo! story:
Intro

Hello there!

My name is Paul, and I am one of those people who enjoy learning.  Being able to see, taste, & touch all elements around me is just one of the small parts of taking in knowledge & experience.  It's nearly an obsession, in fact.  If I could afford to do so, I would be a professional student - a person who learns for a living! Observation is key to this, for I usually find items that most people may walk right past.

Last year, I decided that it's about time I find my way to some place extremely suiting to my needs - New York City!  This trip is tentatively planned for this coming April, and I am looking for any assistance to make this dream come true.

--

Details

* I am looking for a total of around $1000.  This would cover the travel, lodging, food, and entertainment for a 4-day period to tour over NYC.

* In return of any generous donation, there are tiered rewards provided, to be collected from this trip.

--

The Reason Why

I'm looking for this to happen, simply because I have never gone there. I'm a small-town guy who's just not as excited to his surroundings as before. I've seen and heard about so much of NYC that I feel its time I taste it for myself. 

Also, I love documentation. I will certainly be taking photographs and short videos on this trip, to share and provide to others what I've seen & learned.


I'm not entirely penniless, by the way. I do have a job, and I get by paycheck to paycheck. I'm 28 years old, and I just want to see the world more than just the county I live in. I promise you this endeavor will not be a wasteful one. Please take a look at the perks to see more details for what your contribution can award you.

 

Thank you!

story:
Flashtray: The Solar Solution to Instant Fire

Check this out.  This is the Flashtray.  It's a simple and compact fire-starting tool, signal mirror, and ashtray that's completely solar powered.  It doesn't require batteries, fuel, sparks, or magic. All you need is sunlight! 

The precision designed parabolic mirror focuses the sun's rays onto the spring clip in the center of the focal point and in only seconds you've got fire!  Your Physical Science teacher would be proud. 

And for emergencies, there's a signal mirror on the back!  Because being lost sucks. Every year, thousands of people get lost in our nation's parks.  Over 40% result in illness, injury, or death.  Our mirror will keep you on the right side of this statistic."  ~ I got the 40% data from http://www.bioone.org/doi/abs/10.1580/08-WEME-OR-299R.1

The Flashtray folds flat so it's easy to store, and you can clip it to your backpack or your ice chest.  Take it hiking and camping.  Flashtray is great for fishing, boating, and tubing.  Keep one in your RV.  Keep one on your boat.  It's lightweight, durable, and makes a great gift!  Give one to your dad for Christmas.  What the heck, give him two!

A Brief History of Flashtray

Every year, hundreds of millions of discarded cigarette lighters find their way into landfills or sadly even our local parks and hunting grounds.  These tiny plastic butane tanks threaten the wildlife we all enjoy.  We all know there's a problem.  Be part of the solution with Flashtray.

When we began designing the Flashtray, we wanted to build something more durable, more reliable, and basically an all-around better product than anything else on the market.  It had to be small, portable, easy to use, and it absolutely had to work!  So we started from the ground up with professionally designed CAD drawings and 3D printed prototypes for testing, but the next phase is where production gets expensive. 

And that's where you come in.  Your support will help us get through the initial production process as well as the first complete run of Flashtray products! 

Thanks for your support!  We couldn't do it without you!

story:
A Totally Modular Experience

Taskin ROLR is the only toiletry bag you can custom-configure for your specific needs, on every trip you take.

In fact, ROLR is 5 ingeniously-designed toiletry bags rolled into one. You can pack them individually for a quick weekend getaway, or connect them together into whatever configuration you need for your next big client pow-wow in Boston, or that African safari you've been dreaming about. Plus, two or more ROLRs can be combined, so you can zip together custom combinations for a more personalized travel experience. Just don't be surprised if you start wondering how you stayed so fly without it.

 

 

 

At Taskin, we take pride in developing smart, stylish gear for travel and everyday life. We work diligently to understand our customers' needs, and the reasons so many other products fail them. We don't do gear that just "does the job." We do gear that delights. And it shows in our peerless design and craftsmanship.

That includes our upscale toiletry kits. One of the biggest challenges we set out to solve with ROLR: how to design a premium-quality grooming kit that’s the perfect size for everyone, on every trip—near, far and everywhere in-between? The result is a must-have toiletry system that you can easily configure into the exact kit you need for wherever you're jetting next.  

 

5 Kinds of Awesome, All Rolled into 1

The Taskin ROLR premium toiletry system comes with five modular pods ("mod pods") that are optimally designed to hold toiletries of different shapes and sizes. Using Pod 1 as the anchor, each module can be connected to every other module with ease. When your toiletry bag is good-to-go, roll it up flat, or create two toiletry bags to pack separately—whatever fits best.

 

Pod 1: Total Flexibility is in the Bag

Ideal for a whole mix of assorted necessities—shampoo, body wash, conditioner, maybe even your loofah. There's space for your comb or hairbrush, too. Throw in a few other basics, and it's a compact toiletry bag on its own—perfect for one or two day trips. All the other bags will be so jealous!

 

Pod 2: Your Ticket to Miles of Smiles

Need to pack a toothbrush, or a full-size tube of toothpaste? Done and done. An electric trimmer? Tuck that bad boy right here. Expansive, linear pockets make packing these and other necessities effortless. The fact that they keep your toothbrush away from your sunscreen and toenail clippers? Priceless.

 

Pod 3: A Serious Upgrade to Excite the Senses

Perfect for deodorant, sunscreen, moisturizer and handy wipes. Toss in some perfume or cologne, and you're sure to stay soft, smooth and smelling great wherever you roam. The large pockets make packing and retrieving these items a breeze. And while you're in there, can we borrow some lip balm?

 

Pod 4: First-Class Style That Gives Good Face

Designed for your shaving kit, makeup case, and all your other grooming, and beauty essentials. Like razor blades, shaving cream, and aftershave lotion. Your makeup remover, face scrub, Q-tips and cotton pads. If you're into those fancy charcoal masks, go for it. Just remember to peel it off before breakfast.

Pod 5: Discretion Always Travels Well

At the risk of TMI, this pod's for those personal items we don't need to talk about here. Or if you prefer, you can use it to pack your cables, adaptors, doodads and anything else you need to geek out while you're globetrotting.

 

 

 

The ROLR comes with 4 extra-strong suction cups so you can attach it to smooth, flat surfaces like the bathroom mirror. Now, your stuff is always within reach.

 

 

Just like all our gear, the Taskin ROLR is made with select, top-tier materials. We're talking premium 650D ballistic nylon. Genuine YKK zippers. And custom-made, honeycomb nylon mesh. Plus, you always get that Taskin lifetime warranty.

 

ROLR Goes Well With Our Other Hit Products:

All addons will ship by end of September 2019.

Already have these? Then get a head start on your holiday shopping list, all excellent gifts for your family/friends.

 

 

Won't mine for bitcoins or order your pizza, but will up your style—and your game. Here's your chance to get yourself an Edge backpack.

 

 
Miss out on our Kube V2 campaign? Here's your chance to fix that.
 
 

 

 

 

Don't yet have one of our Duplex dual sided packing cubes? Here's your chance to fix that or if you need more, can't have enough packing cubes! 

 

We guarantee your Taskin ROLR will ship from our factory on or before the estimated date—or you can get a full refund. The estimated date provided is the date we ship from the factory, the date you receive your reward will vary depending on your shipping country.

 

Taskin ROLR will ship from UK and we will take care of VAT and customs. The other add-ons (Edge, Kube and Duplex) will ship from US.

 

If the buzz from our past campaigns is any sign, you'll be glad you got your ROLR:

 

 

 

While we expect this campaign to run smoothly, there are always a few risks involved, such as:

  • Any production issues—like that time IBM confused YKK with Y2K and insisted all the zippers needed a software patch (but luckily, that kind of thing only happens once a millennium)
  • Customs holds our shipments on the runway for a few weeks (here's hoping nobody had to use the bathroom)
  • We actually do win the Nobel Prize for solving toilet bags (which seems totally plausible)
  • We've done our best to mitigate these risks by working with a high-end manufacturer that produces gear for major brands. We're using well-established shipping companies that know the ins-and-outs of customs (no peanuts or complimentary beverages required).
  • If challenges do occur, rest assured we'll do our utmost to minimize any delays and to ship your toiletry bag by the estimated time—or you get your money back.
  • There is this little thing called Brexit that might affect our plans depends on how it goes.

But that's just how we ROLR.

story:
Pre-Production Update:

 

Thanks to our early backers' support we are able to kickstart our pre-production and we aim to get CORI SuperTee into your hands as soon as possible. We'll be partnering with CrowdOx for the backer survey management so that you can easily keep track of your pledge. Once again, a big thank you for supporting CORI SuperTee!

Introducing CORI SuperTee

 

Our lives are dynamic. We go from indoors to outdoors, from lunch to afternoon coffee breaks, from long meetings to quick gym sessions, and from road trips to big vacations. Things spill, we sweat, and sh** happens.

That’s why we created the SuperTee. We needed a t-shirt that could handle it all, and that looks good while doing it.

 

From breakfast to the boardroom and to an afternoon jog, the CORI SuperTee has got you covered. All of its features make for a uniquely comfortable T-shirt that you can wear literally anywhere. It's also what makes the SuperTee perfect for travel. It stays fresh as you transition from the airport to the airplane, to the cab and straight to exploring.

*Upgrade from short sleeve to a long-sleeve by adding S$14 per shirt (approximately $10USD)* 

A CrowdOx survey will be sent where you can select your size, color and manage your upgrade to long sleeves. 

 

This isn’t just a great t-shirt coated in useful treatments. It’s a sophisticated shirt made of quality all-natural fabrics that care for your skin and keep you cool, dry and odor-free.

Nothing gets washed off, so it feels like the first wear every time.

Timothy Jacob Jensen is one of Denmark’s most awarded designers. He’s worked with brands like Bang & Olufsen, Ecco, Volvo and Lufthansa 1st Class.

In his collaboration with the CORI SuperTee, he’s embraced the “hygge” principal of minimalist design to create a comfortable, functional, sleek and versatile shirt.

Discover more about our designer and his inspiration behind CORI SuperTee.

 

 

Our marine collagen is extracted from upcycling methods and we source our fabrics from sustainably managed and renewable sources to ensure minimum wastage and maximum utility in every SuperTee. Our factories are WRAP certified to ensure fair wages, reasonable hours and proper working conditions- making for safe, lawful, humane and ethical manufacturing.

 

We’re a group of designers, travelers and explorers that work with proven manufacturing partners who have been delivering quality products for more than 45 years. Our mission is to create the best d*mn travel products for travelers and bring fun and function back to travel accessories.

After our last successful Kickstarter campaign, The World’s Happiest Travel Pillow, we decided to take on another key-travel-item: the T-shirt.

Every day looks different, and we needed a T-shirt that could offer some consistency. On Friday we can go from work to a lunch date to our favorite spinning class. Then on Saturday, we might start with yoga with friends, head to brunch, and then hop in the car to drive two cities over for dinner with the parents. CORI SuperTee can accompany us from start to finish- and make sure we feel fresh and comfortable the whole day long. 

 

To measure, simply place your favorite t-shirt on a flat surface and measure across the Shoulder, Chest (below armpit) and Length to see which of the above sizes matches. The cutting is based on Modern Fit (between Regular and Slim fit) . If you are in-between sizes, either go down a size if you prefer a more fitted look or go up a size for a more relaxed fit.  

 

 Tross is a data driven Crowdfunding company

 

We The People Store is the only chain physical stores in the world to exclusively support, promote and retail products made possible with the power of crowdfunding. For our Singapore backers, visit We The People Millenia Walk and I12 Katong Stores to see CORI SuperTee in action!

story:
We are TACTICA & We Create Award Winning Tools for Everyday Carry

Our M100 (Talon) multi-tool set the record for all-time highest funded multi-tool in crowdfunding history!

Our latest innovation, the M250 hex bit toolkit, is the #1 most recommended feature set from our customers.

M250 hex bit toolkit

Made of the same battle tested, lightweight & durable material as our M100. A unique material used in aerospace and military applications that won't scratch your phone screen.

Unique holster straps to a belt or bag, or magnetically attaches to a metal surface.

Integrated extender helps with hard to reach spots when you need it.

Slots for 14 bits. 12 bits included.

Easily customize your tool with standard hex bits to fit your needs.

There's nothing else like the M250.

Meticulously designed and expertly crafted to last a lifetime at your side.

 

Compact for everyday carry. Integrated holster for your belt or bag.

 

High torque built-in extender gets the job done.

 

 

 

The M250 has been designed from the ground up to deliver you the tools and features you need without weighing you down.   

 


How many times did you find out that you were missing the right screwdriver? With the M250 we wanted to make sure you had the ones you needed. That's why each toolkit comes with 12 of the most common hex bits that you might need & 2 spare slots to add your own. 

The M250 is sized to be compact with it being less than the size of a credit card.

Each toolkit comes with:

 1. Complete screwdriver set - 12 of the most common hex bits you might need. 

  • Phillips hex drive - 1.8mm*, #0, #2  (* 1.8mm suitable for most eye glasses) 
  • Flat hex drive - 1.8mm*, #3, #5 (* 1.8mm suitable for most eye glasses) 
  • Allen hex drives - 3mm, 4mm, 5mm 
  • Torx Hex Drives - T10, T15, T25  

2. M250 magazine - holds your hex bits and includes heavy duty driver

3. Extended reach - 2"/ 50mm hex bit extender 

4. M250 holster - Pocket, belt or on the fridge, the choice is yours

 

 


The patent pending storage system allows you to take your hex bits in and out with ease. The TPU retention elastomer ensures your bits stay in place securely. So no need to worry about pieces falling out in your bag or pocket.


Similar to the M100 multitool, the M250 features a hardened stainless steel insert to ensure you have the necessary strength to budge even the toughest of screws*. Combined with the wider body, the M250 also gives you the leverage you need. 

   *Screws driven in by the Hulk not covered


Each M250 comes with an integrated 50mm/ 2" hex bit extender. Perfect for getting to those hard to reach places or when you can't get your tool in the right spot. The extender features a magnetic tip to ensure your bits stay in place when in use.     


What would a toolkit be without an easy way to carry it. Each M250 comes with its own holster that keeps the toolkit magazine in place and allows you to carry it wherever you want. 

A clip on the side of the holster allows for pocket or belt carry... 

 

...And a magnetic plate lets you attach it to the fridge at home, the office or the workshop. Just attach it to any metal surface and you're away.    

 

The M250 holster also comes with an attachment point to loop into your bags. Seen here with the latest Peak Design backpack.   


Travelling interstate or to another country? No need to worry as the M250 complies with current TSA regulations for airtravel. Please see FAQ for more details 


The M250 uses an engineering grade composite that makes it not only 40% lighter than titanium but also doesn't scratch your technology. So now your ipad, iphones and other technology are safe from scratches next to your M250

 

 

No matter what you do from work, sport, hobbies or around the house, it's the small things that can become BIG and stop you in your tracks. The M250 was created to help keep you doing what you love...and to get through the things you don't, quicker.  

 

 

LIFETIME WARRANTY

We love our products and take care when designing and making them. This is why we stand by this and offer a lifetime warranty on the M250 (see warranty details in the FAQ).

 

 

WHAT'S INCLUDED IN EACH M250


ADVANCED COMPOSITE

A feature of the M250 is the use of an advanced engineering grade composite in the Magazine. This provides both an ultra lightweight structure (~40% lighter than titanium) with the necessary strength. The composite is typically used as a metal replacement and perfect for our requirements for the high torque socket.  

PROTOTYPING

Over the course of of 2018-2019 we have been busy developing and refining the M250. Some 50+ prototypes we created over the course of this period. In addition we have further developed our existing M100 multitool that uses alot of the manufacturing + material technology. As such we are confident in the final design that we have pushed to production.

 

TOOLING HAS STARTED

Yes that's right, tooling has already commenced. This means that the design has been refined and now locked down ready for the first samples. Once tooling has been completed we will be testing out the off-tool samples and adjusting as required. 

The images below show some of the tooling being machined in preparation for our initial sample run.

 

 

 

Tactica create cool stuff for your everyday adventures.

In 2016 Tactica we launched our founding product the Talon multitool on kickstarter. It quickly went on to become the highest funded multitool in crowdfunding history and over 8000 backers supporting us. 

Our backers and supporters are a key part of the way we create our innovations at Tactica. Our "Test Pilot" program allows some backers to get their hands on early production versions of our products to test them out and provide much needed feedback. With your help we are able to make great innovations that deliver.

As such we are confident in the final design that we have pushed to production. TOOLING HAS STARTEDYes that's right, tooling has already commenced. This means that the design has been refined and now locked down ready for the first samples. Once tooling has been completed we will be testing out the off-tool samples and adjusting as required. The images below show some of the tooling being machined in preparation for our initial sample run.   

  Tactica create cool stuff for your everyday adventures.In 2016 Tactica we launched our founding product the Talon multitool on kickstarter. It quickly went on to become the highest funded multitool in crowdfunding history and over 8000 backers supporting us. Our backers and supporters are a key part of the way we create our innovations at Tactica. Our "Test Pilot" program allows some backers to get their hands on early production versions of our products to test them out and provide much needed feedback. With your help we are able to make great innovations that deliver. 
 
OTHER ADD ONS
Many people have asked for us to add some additional Add-ons to be available. We are excited to bring you 3 add-ons when you select one of the perks. You can see more images here
M100 Multitool - this is our world record breaking multitool. It features 17 tools in one including bottle opener, package opener, metric and imperial wrenches and rulers, storage for 2 x hex drives and 2 x heavy duty sockets.
M100X - includes the M100 multitool and the MX.01 toolpack. The toolpack features 12 of the most common hex drives:
Phillips hex drive - 1.8mm*, #0, #2  (* 1.8mm suitable for most eye glasses) Flat hex drive - 1.8mm*, #3, #5 (* 1.8mm suitable for most eye glasses) Allen hex drives - 3mm, 4mm, 5mm Torx Hex Drives - T10, T15, T25  
MX.01 Connect - this is our attachment system that allows you to carry your M100 or M250 by keychain, bag or any other way you want.

story:
Do you find yourself jumping between your down jacket and your synthetic jacket? Why should you have to choose between a bulky warm jacket and a light versatile jacket. 

The Outdoor Vitals LoftTek™ Adventure jacket solves this problem. We’ve designed it to be light, warm, versatile, and durable for your all your adventures.

We didn’t hold back on any features. We didn’t design it to hit a price point for a shelf in a store, but rather to be the most versatile ultralight jacket out there. Most jackets don’t have all of  the features we do. If they did, they would be $200 - $300 jackets. This jacket has all the features you need without the heavy price tag.

LoftTek™ is the world's most advanced synthetic down imitation. The loose fill nature of the fibers mimics down’s extreme weight to warmth ratios and packability, while the it’s synthetic nature allows it to stay warm in wet conditions!

Unlike down, LoftTek uses siliconized fibers that dry quickly and always stay lofted for optimal warmth - even when wet.

You get the ultralight warmth and packability of down and the versatility and moisture advantages of synthetic. 

The LoftTek™ Adventure Jacket is the perfect adventure jacket because it doesn’t require much packing space. The best part is, you can pack the entire jacket into its own pocket. Use it when you need and and pack it into itself when you don’t. 

Because of it’s ultra soft material, your packed jacket can also second as a pillow. Another way to save space without compromising your comfort.

Never worry again about the rain catching up to you. Our LoftTek™ Adventure Jacket is coated so that water will bead up and roll off rather than absorb into the fabric.

The LoftTek™ Adventure Jacket is fully weatherproof and can stand up to the harshest  conditions including snow, rain, cold temperatures, and extreme wind without sacrificing warmth or performance.

To give you most heat and stabilization - the baffle design minimizes sewing lines, also known as cold spots, while still keeping the insulation in place and stable.

Because our jackets aren’t technically a down jacket, we don’t need the extra down proof coating. This makes the material more breathable for those active journey days.

Zip up the jacket and feel the hood hug your neck. Now you can keep the unwanted air out and stay comfortable.

For added warmth and protection, we made sure to insulate the entire hood.

For better head movement, our hoods have two different elastic cord adjustments. This allows you to cinch the hood around your face as well as keep the hood tight to the back of your head. No more turning your head and having the hood stay facing forward.

If you find yourself storing too much warmth, use the underarm zippers to release some of the heat. These are especially useful during high activity. 

The thumbholes in the sleeve ends allow the sleeves to stay fully extended and in place, even when layering up or being active. Avoid shivers up your arms - especially during super active use. You can also put gloves on in order to really make sure your hands are nice and warm.

If thumbholes and gloves aren’t enough, dip your hands into your pockets. Carefully designed, the pocket sits behind the insulation of the jacket allowing your hands to stay toasty and protected.

Make sure you don’t lose any of your valuables while on your epic adventure.

The insulation dries extremely quickly so if you need to wash it in a hostel or hotel sink, it can air dry fast and be ready to go the next day.

We believe that some of our best trips are one where we can live in the adventure. During our best adventures we feel prepared and comfortable, which allows us to live in the moment. We designed the The Outdoor Vitals LoftTek™ Adventure Jacket to give you everything you need without holding you back wherever you are. Whether your adventure is bar hopping in the city with your friends, or hiking in Yosemite, you need a jacket that can do it all, so that you can too! And we believe that with the LoftTek™ Adventure Jacket you can. 

This pillow is your saving grace in the backcountry! The stretch nylon material stretches and moves with your head providing a more comfortable night sleep without feeling like your sleeping on a rock for a pillow! The stretch nylon material also feels like a pillowcase to your skin that breathes and feels natural.

Often times as backpackers we use lumpy clothes as a pillow and wonder why we don't sleep well. Well, with the Outdoor Vitals stretch pillow, you'll never consider leaving this little. 2.6 oz luxury comfort pillow behind!

A few years ago our founder Tayson started Outdoor Vitals to help outdoor enthusiasts to “Live Ultralight” through use of premium ultralight products that cut down on waste. We believe Living Ultralight means using premium gear that works in any weather, and is easy to pack and won’t slow you down. It means buying less quantity to fill up our earth’s landfills and buying more quality products that are ready for all your adventures.

He knew that premium gear was inherently lighter, lasted longer and provided better outdoor experiences, however the price of the gear was out of reach for him and his family. He wanted outdoor adventurers to spend less on gear and more on experiences so Outdoor Vitals sell direct to consumers online to save you 40-50% off of retail store prices. He also feels very fortunate while others around the world have not been as fortunate, so Outdoor Vitals donates 1% of revenues to sustainable poverty projects around the world. 

The Outdoor Vitals team is now focused on becoming the next generation outdoor brand to rival the retail giants. Join with us and start Living Ultralight today!

When we started, we only had $500 to put into the company - and we never took venture capital. We determined that a family owned company is better at creating value for customers. While the company has grown to be a 9 figure brand, it's still extremely vital to our growth that we use crowdfunding platforms to help us compete with investment company owned or venture capital backed outdoor brands. We believe that focusing on long term value for our customers is more important than reporting to investors about how to maximize the next months profits.

Huge Thanks To Our Campaign Partners:

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $250MM raised between them.

story:
Thank you!

We wouldn't be possible, MODL wouldn't be possible, without you.

We are living a true dream of ours and we want to make sure you know that by checking out this tiny little corner of the internet, you are helping us do what we love. Keep doing you.

Thank you.

Risks & challenges

Now, you might be thinking… “This is their first crowdfunding campaign, no way they don’t bungle it.” This crossed our minds as well, so we spent the last year and a half taking steps to ensure that you receive an exceptional quality product that’s on-point and on-time.

To start, we partnered with a veteran manufacturer of silicone bottles. After five rounds of prototyping with this manufacturer, we’re confident in their ability to produce MODL, but we will also be on-site for MODL’s production to ensure any slip-ups are resolved quickly.

We are working with a technology-powered freight forwarder to ship your MODL overseas and we have joined forces with a logistics partner with tons of experience fulfilling crowdfunding campaigns like this one to make sure your bottle gets to your door promptly.

Despite our best efforts to mitigate our risks, some factors such as the trade situation with China or raw material shortages are out of our control. While we can’t predict every situation, we pledge to be transparent and proactive through every step of the process

story:
Summary

For sailboats of all sizes and ages, mobile apps are making advanced navigation functions easy and accessible.  The SailTimer charting app (below right) provides a quick and easy display of your optimal tacks and Tacking Time to Destination (TTD ®).  Unfortunately, apps are difficult to navigate with if you can’t see the screen out on the water where the sun is bright and reflecting.  Wearing sunglasses makes it even worse.  And if you turn up the screen brightness, your tablet/phone runs out of battery power and gets warmer.  

All sailors need wind information, so that’s why SailTimer Inc. started making the first-ever masthead anemometer that could transmit to tablets and smartphones back in 2012.  The newest 5th-generation SailTimer Wind Instrument™ is shown below (left).   The SailTimer charting app uses wireless wind data and tacking distances to calculate your optimal tacks.  But there is no sense displaying a wind gauge or your optimal tacks if you can’t see the screen.  It is time to set a new standard for sailboat navigation, with Audio Tacking.  No more squinting at screens out in the sun. 

This is quick and easy, so you can sail the boat.  Keeps your hands free.  No more screen;  the app just tells you the boat speed, tacking results and wind conditions in pre-set intervals.  That could be anytime conditions change more than a certain amount, or just when you tap the screen.  Amazingly simple.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to make an Android charting app for the SailTimer tacking results, and build to the next generation audio interface (for both Android and iOS), but we need your help.  You’ll be able to use the SailTimer tacking results in a free SailTimer charting app on iOS and now on Android too.  And as a backer, you’ll get discounts on the new Audio Tacking for Android or iOS and on the wireless Wind Instrument.

We already used a voice interface in the SailTimer Wind Gauge app on Android (above center).  Now we are ready to go to the next level, with full navigation and optimal tacks on Android.  We need funds (flexible amount) to build a brand-new free app on Android with the SailTimer tacking results overlaid on Google Maps and aerial photos worldwide.  That will allow you to see waypoints and tacking results on Android.  But on both iOS and this new Android version, Audio Tacking will now be available.  

Perks:  Audio Tacking is an ongoing service where you'll be getting free updates with these AI functions continuing to evolve. As a backer, you can get Audio Tacking at increasing discounts depending on whether you get a 1-year, 3-year or lifetime subscription.  We expect it to be available in the SailTimer charting apps on iOS and Android by March 2018.  As sailors ourselves, we know that the tacking results work best with live wind data coming in to your tablet/smartphone.  So the perks also include an option to get the wireless, solar-powered SailTimer Wind Instrument™ at a discount with Audio Tacking.  The Wind Instrument is already in stock, so will ship to you immediately. 

 

Audio Changes Everything

HOW IT WORKS:  You can put your screen to sleep to save power and reduce heat, and put the tablet someplace safe so you don’t have to worry about it.  Keep your hands free for sailing.  Very simple;  if you want to hear Audio Tacking at any time, just tap on the screen (even if it is off).   You can also ask for automatic updates if wind and GPS conditions change a certain amount.  Like Alexa, Siri and OK Google, but also very practical for navigating. 

Simple and easy:

1. Connect tablet/phone to wireless SailTimer Wind Instrument on Bluetooth.

2. Enter waypoint with a tap (or paste in a list).

3. That’s it;  optimal tacks update automatically.

 

WHAT YOU HEAR:  “Wind speed 7.8 knots.  Boat speed 4.2 knots.  Heading 192 degrees.  Bearing starboard 17 degrees would save 1 hour 12 minutes.”

This is a simple message.  But it is actually very sophisticated data.  

You can set how much of a change you want before an audio notification.  You can also choose if you want to hear:  Apparent/True wind, heading, wind angle/direction, TTD, tacking distance, bearing of optimal tack, and how long until the next tack (time and/or distance).

This is a totally different approach.  GPS chartplotters are waterproof and can be seen out on the water, but they are expensive and don’t provide your optimal tacks and Tacking Time to Destination (TTD®).  A lot more people have marine navigation apps, but those are hard to see.  Problem solved.

This even works great on small boats, where there are no instrument displays or 12-volt battery.

 

Risks & Challenges

Out of all of the GPS chartplotters and apps out there, the SailTimer app is the only product that uses tacking distance to determine optimal tacks and Tacking Time to Destination (TTD®).  It was the first app with polar plot learning, and set a new standard for sailboat navigation with a different approach than the ETA and VMG on most GPS chartplotters.  Our goal will be to move the same functions from the highly-respected SailTimer app on iOS into an Android version.  And then to add Audio Tacking to both.

The wireless, solar-powered SailTimer Wind Instrument™ is in stock now for delivery to you.  We will provide access codes for the subscriptions when Audio Tacking is available.  There is little technical risk involved, since we have been using the patented SailTimer tacking results for over 10 years.  The innovative SailTimer products have been covered in pretty much all of the sailing media over the years, as shown in the examples below.  We also already have the tacking results in the widely-respected SailTimer app on iOS, and the SailTimer Wind Gauge app on Android already has some audio capabilities. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to cover the costs of making an Android app to overlay the SailTimer tacking results on maps, and to build the Audio Tacking for iOS and Android.  This is a whole new approach to navigating out in the sun with wireless devices and mobile apps.  You’ll still need marine charts in unfamiliar waters.  But now you can simply hear key navigation information like wind angle, wind speed, boat speed and optimal tacks.  Keep your hands free, with no squinting at a tablet/smartphone out in the sun.  No more screen at all.

Please spread the word.  Backing this project also lets us know about customer interest in this innovative new audio interface. 

All sailors need good wind and tacking information, at low cost, without a screen that is hard to see outside.  Help us fix this problem.

story:
ABOUT

Being frustrated with breaking our bank every winter buying new and expensive goggles we challenged ourselves yet again: Launch high-quality goggles at a fraction of the price of comparable quality brands. And to continue to facilitate the clean up of 10 KG plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean pr. product sold.

After designing, producing and endless testing we're now very proudly presenting MessyWeekend Snow Goggles XE•ONE.

 

Product development & design process

Back in June we traveled to Asia to investergate a number of raw material manufacturers and eyewear factories. After a dozen visits we chose our factory based on physical working conditions, quality of current production, known brands in production and delivery times. Together with the factory and raw material manufacturers we had a number of prototypes produced in different designs and functionalities from which we chose the current design/model and sat specific quality requirements according to the FDA and CE mark standards, as well as our own. Working on the lense we reviewed several options, both in terms of design and functionality regarding ventilation and lens changing system. We chose the most clean design where you change the lens by bending back the top and bottom of the frame. According to our lens manufacturer the 6 vents on the lense have an optimal shape, size and placement to prevent fog which is why these are generic. In addition to this the prototyping process included selection of: specific lens type incl. coating inside and outside, quality of foam and number of layers, strap design and quality incl. specific silicon lines and positioning of these for optimal anti-slip, design of hard case and microfiber pouches. In addition to this for every product we sell, we secure the clean-up of 10kg of plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean.

This project is all about bringing high quality, great looking googles to the market at very affordable prices and at the same time honoring our 1=10 program by donating a significant part of the revenue to the NGO ProArtso. Our ambition is to gain market shares from the existing market leaders that are selling products with an immense gap between the cost and the consumer price. We therefore believe we are benefitting both end-consumers and the environment. On November 4th we travelled back to China to follow the production and made sure everything is on track.

 

 

Visible Light Transmission % of the goggles

Red/Yellow mirror: 11.2% 
Silver mirror: 8% 
Blue mirror: 18.5% 
Green mirror: 23.7% 
Clear yellow: 55%

SHIPPING IN JANUARY

WHO WE ARE?

Back in April 2018, we launched MessyWeekend sunglasses, today we're selling our sunglasses globally. The co-founders of MESSYWEEKEND are serial entrepreneurs Morten Heick, previous investment banker and tech entrepreneur, along with Marc Østerskov, FMCG, telco, and e-commerce marketer. You can see us, and a big part of the team in the video above - no actors. :-)

To make all this happen, we need your help! So please, every single backer counts in making our dream of making high-quality goggles more accessible.

 

With every pair of MW's we sell, we facilitate the removal of 10 kg plastic waste from beaches facing the Pacific Ocean. 

We have a partnership with the NGO ProArtso, and we have a focus on sustainable solutions. Our donation supports the education of local communities building knowhow of waste sorting and recycling. This setup ensures that harmful plastic is removed, the local communities become educated, and the waste is turned into a source of income for the local communities as they sell it for recycling. In other words: A smart little ecosystem is born.

Risks & Challenges

The product: We have developed and tested our MessyWeekend snow Googles together with professional freestyle and alpine riders. Our manufacturer produces ski goggles for 2 out of the worlds top 5 ski goggles brands and has a long history of manufacturing for brands that are being used by Olympic athletes and focus is on quality, duration and fit.

The manufacturing: We've developed a strong relationship with our world-class manufacturing partner. We have been working together through multiple sample iterations and visits to their factory. 

Delivery time: We are working closely with our manufacturer to make sure production goes smoothly. We will do our best to fulfil all orders as soon as possible, but we cannot guarantee 100% that our manufacturer will deliver on the deadlines in their contract. 

Duties and Taxes 
All prices are including VAT, duties/taxes inside the USA and EU/EEA. If you live outside of the USA, EU/EEA, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. NOTE: While we wish we could help get our packages to you faster, we have no control over customs processing times.

Stay tuned for updates!

Working on the lense we reviewed several options, both in terms of design and functionality regarding ventilation and lens changing system. We chose the most clean design where you change the lens by bending back the top and bottom of the frame. According to our lens manufacturer the 6 vents on the lense have an optimal shape, size and placement to prevent fog which is why these are generic. In addition to this the prototyping process included selection of: specific lens type incl. coating inside and outside, quality of foam and number of layers, strap design and quality incl. specific silicon lines and positioning of these for optimal anti-slip, design of hard case and microfiber pouches. In addition to this for every product we sell, we secure the clean-up of 10kg of plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean.
This project is all about bringing high quality, great looking googles to the market at very affordable prices and at the same time honoring our 1=10 program by donating a significant part of the revenue to the NGO ProArtso. Our ambition is to gain market shares from the existing market leaders that are selling products with an immense gap between the cost and the consumer price. We therefore believe we are benefitting both end-consumers and the environment. On November 4th we travelled back to China to follow the production and made sure everything is on track.

WHO WE ARE?
Back in April 2018, we launched MessyWeekend sunglasses, today we're selling our sunglasses globally. The co-founders of MESSYWEEKEND are serial entrepreneurs Morten Heick, previous investment banker and tech entrepreneur, along with Marc Østerskov, FMCG, telco, and e-commerce marketer. You can see us, and a big part of the team in the video above - no actors. :-)
To make all this happen, we need your help! So please, every single backer counts in making our dream of making high-quality goggles more accessible.

 
With every pair of MW's we sell, we facilitate the removal of 10 kg plastic waste from beaches facing the Pacific Ocean. 
We have a partnership with the NGO ProArtso, and we have a focus on sustainable solutions. Our donation supports the education of local communities building knowhow of waste sorting and recycling. This setup ensures that harmful plastic is removed, the local communities become educated, and the waste is turned into a source of income for the local communities as they sell it for recycling. In other words: A smart little ecosystem is born.


Risks & Challenges
The product: We have developed and tested our MessyWeekend snow Googles together with professional freestyle and alpine riders. Our manufacturer produces ski goggles for 2 out of the worlds top 5 ski goggles brands and has a long history of manufacturing for brands that are being used by Olympic athletes and focus is on quality, duration and fit.
The manufacturing: We've developed a strong relationship with our world-class manufacturing partner. We have been working together through multiple sample iterations and visits to their factory. 
Delivery time: We are working closely with our manufacturer to make sure production goes smoothly. We will do our best to fulfil all orders as soon as possible, but we cannot guarantee 100% that our manufacturer will deliver on the deadlines in their contract. 
Duties and Taxes All prices are including VAT, duties/taxes inside the USA and EU/EEA. If you live outside of the USA, EU/EEA, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. NOTE: While we wish we could help get our packages to you faster, we have no control over customs processing times.
